Reviews.Title: Excellent overall TV
Reviews.Author: Fred 123
Reviews.Content: UPDATE 06/26/2012: I have been really enjoying the TV for about a year now and am still amazed at the picture quality. I did contact LG recently about any harmful emissions or radiation that might come from the screen (as I use it quite a bit for both TV viewing and as a PC monitor), wondering if I should buy protective eye gear (I had been using various lens but decided to ask them before I purchased another pair....I had 2 pair break). They wrote back the same day and said that there is virtually no radiation from the screen.End of UPDATE.The set up is fairly easy although I found the manual to be lacking in more detail, especially concerning a better explanation of some of the features.The HD picture is just AWESOME and BEAUTIFUL. I thought the screen might be a little too big for my computer but I was totally wrong....it is just great! I do not have a HDMI connector for the PC, only the RGB, but it is still just outstanding. Hook-up was a matter of just connecting the plugs.The sound is better than good, but not great. (BELOW you will see how I was able to improve it....QUITE A BIT!!)I was going to give it 4 stars because the non-HD channels are just good, and acceptable; but, the more I look at it, I realize it is actually pretty good. So, it warrants 5 stars.I have seen a number of HDTVs, especially in showrooms, and this one seems to be better than those. It truly has an amazing picture with HD and I am very pleased with the purchase.UPDATE 07/09/2011: After tinkering with the set for a month or so, I have been able to improve the sound CONSIDERABLY.....and it was pretty good to start with. Here's how I did it: Press "Menu", then "Audio". Turn "Auto" sound OFF! Next, I have  the "Clear Voice II" turned "On" and set to 0 (the more I increased it to the maximum of +6, the more background static I got). MOST IMPORTANTLY, I use the "MUSIC" mode..this produces a much more dynamic sound! Then adjust Treble and Bass to your liking and CLOSE. I get a really great sound. I use 56 treble and 89 bass.This is a 10/29/2012 UPDATE: I had ordered the Bose SOLO one piece system which is a single unit dedicated to increasing TV sound quality. I followed their instructions to the tee and used the best connection they recommended, as well as turning off the TV speakers when testing the sound.  Oops.....the LG had a nicer and more dynamic sound! I have since returned the Bose system (they were great about taking it back....even paid for UPS return postage). Actually, the SOLO unit has gotten some bad reviews on here, even though more good than bad.UPDATE 10/31/2012: After messing with the "Video" for over a year I have finally gotten what I consider to be a better picture than the "Standard" or "Intelligent Sensor" modes. Basically, I use the first option of 16:9 Ratio....then skip using the "Picture Wizard" (it is quite involved but it might work for you)....and chose the "Vivid (User)" option for the viewing mode. You can see what you like under the various adjustments of "Sharpness", "Contrast" etc.. Under "Advance Control", I have all the options set on "High"  except for "Black Level", which I have on "Low". Then "Close".

Reviews.Title: Great TV For The Money
Reviews.Author: Moviegeek
Reviews.Content: I must preface my review by saying I didn't buy the LG 450 online, I bought it at a big box store because they had a better price:I wanted an inexpensive TV for the bedroom and the LG 450 is a good choice, the picture quality is very good for it's price. I didn't need 120Hz so I saved $150 by buying the 60Hz model. The LG 450 has Expert ISF Settings so you can have it professionally calibrated or do it yourself, it has a built-in blue filter and calibration wizard. The ATSC tuner is very powerful because I get all the local stations OTA with an indoor antenna. This model is not internet enabled so you need a set top box to get Netflix, etc. As with all TV's the sound isn't great but it does have bass and treble controls. The USB port supports: JPG, MP3, MPG, MP4. The manual states other video formats are supported but they wouldn't work on my TV.Inputs:HDMI(3)VGA(1)USB(1)Component(2)Composite(2)Outputs:3.5mm headphoneToslink opticalI recommend these basic settings(YMMV):1. Turn off Dynamic Contrast.2. Turn off Auto Energy Saving.3. Turn on Real Cinema, if your Blu-ray player supports 24p then turn that on as well.4. Select Just Scan.5. In Sound Modes select Music or Cinema.

Reviews.Title: A pleasant surprise
Reviews.Author: Danny
Reviews.Content: == UPDATE 2/22/13 ==After owning this TV for about a year now, I my recommendation still stands. Runs like a champ, I haven't had a single issue. I will probably not upgrade for another year.== Original Review ==I honestly didn't know what to expect. I bought this TV on sale at Best Buy for 100 dollars off. I was in the market for a new TV, actually my first TV purchase.After a week of use, I am very very pleased with my purchase.The picture quality is fantastic. Every aspect of the picture can be customized- how warm the picture is, brightness, gamma exposure, etc. Let me say, out of the box the picture was great, this options are more for if you are very particular.The sound quality is adequate. Not the absolute best, but it is a very solid TV. My dad's bravia's sound quality is a lot worse so I am thankful that this setup is good.As far as features are concerned- it has all of the standards (sleep timer, auto-on/off, etc). It is missing picture-in-picture but this seems almost irrelevant for the size of the TV. I am throughly impressed with the number of inputs and outputs on this TV. 3 HDMI ports, 2 regular RCA (red, white, yellow) inputs, and the PC cord. The PC cord input even has a headphone audio input! This makes using my long cord very easy and converter free.As a note, I use the TV with my PS3 and PC, and both look and sound fantastic.I am very pleased with this purchase and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Awesome low end TV
Reviews.Author: Tan
Reviews.Content: I've been watching HD TV and movies from the LCD monitor on my computer for the last few years because I vowed I would not spend more than $500 for a boob tube, but now I've finally found something that I would be happy with for $499. This LG is a very basic, no-frills TV, but it's all that I need in a TV. The features are very base level and the specs on the contrast may make it seem like it has a phenomenal picture but it's really just average for this price range, which is to say that it's perfectly adequate. It's basically what you would expect from an IPS panel. You can move around the room and the image is perfectly viewable no matter where you sit. The backlight is adequate and turned all the way up is not glaring.One of the first things you'll notice is that the power "button" is not a button, but a touch-sensitive area that requires no effort to turn on. That's nice because the TV is so light that pressing a conventional button on this TV would probably move it around a tiny bit. The TV takes a few seconds before you see an image but that's quite tolerable. Changing channels is about as fast as other recent TVs but definitely slower than a computer with a USB tuner. That's perfectly fine for me since I don't intend to channel surf with this TV.It's nice that the unit offers a calibration wizard but I did not like how the recommended contrast setting made darker images lose detail.  I ended up turning the contrast almost all the way up. There's really not much to say about the image quality.  It's perfectly decent and I didn't find any noticeable flaws. So far I've mostly used it to play Lego Batman and there is no image lag that I've read about in other TVs. One thing I've noticed is that with computer to HDMI connections, the default is overscan mode so you have to adjust your video settings to decrease the image size to fit entirely within the TV screen. Once you do the image looks great. There is also VGA port, but that it does not handle full HD resolution.There are two menu systems, a quick menu and a more comprehensive menu that gives you all of the controls that you would ever need. That's thoughtful of LG as I've always disliked having to delve deeply into a menu system to do something as simple as deleting an unwanted channel. It still takes a minimum of three presses though.  It would be nice if they had provided a button just for that on the remote.Like many TVs at this price point, it only provides optical audio out which is ironic since most buyers of  cheaper TVs don't have stereo systems that have optical in. Fortunately, there is at least a headphone port that can be used to connect to computer speakers or even a stereo receiver. This is important because the performance of the built-in speakers are not proportional to the size of the screen. At 42" this is a decent size for a small home theater yet the speakers cannot provide that experience. That's OK--I didn't expect it to and I've got external speakers to take over.Although they skimped on the audio out, they covered the video inputs well.  There are component as well as composite inputs as well as three HDMI ports. And there is a conventional USB port instead of the more limited memory card reader. I played a couple videos through USB and it handled the job flawlessly. I was very pleased to find that it kept track of where you stopped a video last time you watched it. It's little things like that that make this TV stand out from cheaper ones.I did a ton of shopping to find something with a good picture that doesn't break the bank. Many new TVs sold now are much more expensive and have a lot of buzzword features which this unit does not have. This unit is basically a brand new TV with last year's features. I'm fine with that as long as I get a bigger screen for the money.

Reviews.Title: Average 1080p LCD, dead pixels on our first set
Reviews.Author: M
Reviews.Content: The brown plastic strip across the bottom looks like a sticker and we feel that it actually makes the TV look cheaper than it is. Solid piano black would have a cleaner look. -1 star on "curb appeal".The first set we received came with a dead pixel in the center but the second one is good so far. -1 star on having to replace first unit.Other than that, this is our third HDTV and the details are what you'd expect from 1080p. Side by side with the Samsung equivalent (both tv's set to default settings) the colors are noticibly less vivid. Even when toying with the settings, it just doesn't have the same WOW factor. For almost $100 cheaper (listed $379 at time of review), ~25% at this price point, worth the minor sacrifice.All in all, happy with the purchase and would buy LG again as long as they continue to price lower than the competition.

Reviews.Title: New to HDTV
Reviews.Author: OldReno
Reviews.Content: I'm finally coming into the 21st century with a flat panel HDTV. When the big switch came to HDTV, my satellite provider said their signal would be adjusted and I wouldn't need to upgrade the receiver or my older 27" Zenith since it was still functioning perfectly. Recently, my Zenith started acting up so I started shopping for a new TV and settled on the LG 32LK450 1080P. All I can say is WOW!!! I'm sorry now that I waited so long to upgrade. I connected it to the receiver I was using with the Zenith but will be having the satellite system upgraded to HD next week. With the awesome quality of the picture already, it is hard to imagine it could get any better. I'm not a techno geek so the audio for me was fine right out of the box. All I had to do is take it out of the carton, attach the stand, and plug it in. When turning it on the first time, there were a couple on-screen settings to put in order then it was ready to enjoy. Amazon had the best price I could find so they got my order. Standard shipping took a reasonable 7 days from their warehouse to my house. I like this unit so much I'm now looking at buying a second one in the 42" model.

Reviews.Title: LG The Best!
Reviews.Author: Christine Best "crissyb"
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased with my purchase.  This TV has great picture & sound.  The menu is almost idoit proof!  My husband and I like different settings when watching tv so changing options frequently has become so easy with this tv. We never found a better price for this model!  I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic low-end LCD TV.
Reviews.Author: RC
Reviews.Content: I was recently in the market for a basic 40"-ish LCD TV for my bedroom and just happened to stumble upon this gem of a set. I did not require internet connectivity, smart functions, Hulu, Netflix, True-motion processing, 3D, automatic espresso's, or a shiatsu back massage. All I required was a nice screen so that I could watch direct tv and blu-rays with my fiancee. So when I recently received a kindle special offer for $100 off on HDTV's sold by Amazon, I decided that it was meant to be.I ended up purchasing this set for $397.00 shipped to my door (On 09/12/11). Simply a mind blowing price for a full 1080p 42" lcd screen. I am pleased to say this set has already past my expectations for a product at this price point. The TV took me less than 10 minutes to get set up (by myself), and the picture is just incredible. I have a 2010 Samsung 46" LED LCD TV in my den that I paid $1400 for last year. This set looks just as good, and its very hard to see the size difference between the two screens. I almost feel like I'm watching the same TV, but for $1000 less.The sound is a bit lacking (as noted in other reviews), and the inclusion of only an optical out for audio is puzzling since most people looking for a low end tv still use analog audio. Luckily my bedroom stereo has an optical input.Pros:- Price- Fantastic Picture... Rich colors, bright whites, dark blacks, etc...- Easy to use menu- 3 HDMI outs and a USB input- PriceCons:- Speakers are lacking- No analog audio outConclusion:This TV is a fantastic purchase if you're looking for a bare bones 40"-42" LCD TV. You'll be hard pressed to find better than the LG 42LK450.

Reviews.Title: First reviewer's experience
Reviews.Author: PR
Reviews.Content: I haven't seen too many reviews for this so I'll try and give one.  Like the other reviewer this is my first HDTV so if there was anything bad to say about this tv it would have to be pretty significant.  I don't see any Y in the product code anywhere so I guess it's entirely possible that Amazon only sells the VA versions and not the IPS.  Overall, the color and resolution is great and so is the sound.  Xbox games look fantastic and HD movies are clear. With about only 6 screws the floor stand assembly wasn't difficult at all and connecting devices to the tv is also very hassle-free with a few HDMI and USB ports on the side as well as the back.  Lastly, the remote doesn't take long to learn and is free of convoluted unnecessary buttons.The options menu is very easy to navigate.  Adjusting the picture isn't difficult at all.  Along with the normal picture adjustment settings there are preset picture setting shortcuts that are for specific functions (ex. sports, gaming, movies, ect.) making it very easy to switch from one viewing experience to another if you're that type of person.  The lighting issues that some other people might be having are easily fixed by going into the display options and changing the picture mode (intelligent sensor issue) or just by lowering/turning off the energy saver option (screen dimming issue).  Hooking my pc up to the tv was extremely easy; the only problem was getting an audio cable that connects the pc to the tv speakers.  I doubt most people would try this but you can just use the same cable that they sell at Walmart for about $10 that connects a mp3 player to your car's head unit and not have any problems.  The only problem I have is that the tv display of the computer screen is a little too large and cuts off the very right side just enough to where you can't see the vertical scrolling bar for internet explorer or any programs' red close button.  I tried fixing this but the manual says that some graphics cards cause the image to not be positioned correctly on the screen so I guess it's not a common problem.

Reviews.Title: Decent HDTV
Reviews.Author: Truth Seeker
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this set and two things come to mind:1. This HDTV is nowhere near the sleek slim device as shown in the pictures. It is actually a quite bulky unattractive bezel. Look closely before you purchase because there is an atrocious light brown sticker like strip across at the bottom of the bezel about a 1/2 inch thick. I find myself looking at that more then the TV at times (reminds me of austin powers staring at the Mole on someones face) just cant help it.2. The picture is OK, i have an older 2008 Samsung LCD TV which looks a bit crisper and clearer on ESPN, dont ask me, did a bit of calibration too. Bluray does look great though cant complain about that. Also a very slight bit of motion blur watching football. I know its only 60hz but never experienced that before.Overall a decent set for the price, nice features, plenty of inputs, good PC connectivity, cant complain too much aside from the aesthetics of the Bezel, also LCD is older technology. For a mere $40 you can upgrade to the LG 32 LED version with a sleeker, sexier bezel and avoid that atrocious brown strip and bulky panel. You also get newer technology. I am considering returning it for that model. Anyhow, everyone is different just my 2 cents. Happy Shopping.

Reviews.Title: One word...Phenomenal
Reviews.Author: D. Swan
Reviews.Content: This TV is really nice looking and super lightweight. Right out of the box and hooked up to Cable, free local HD looks Phenomenal! SD looks really good too. I've seen a lot of HD TV's and this picture is the best I've seen! No tweaking. Just changed the picture mode to "vivid" and it looks unbelievable. Save your money and get 60 mz. There's no difference. And it doesn't have the weird effects some 120 hz have. I really like the menu on this too. It's all in a circle onscreen that rotates...really cool and simple feature. The sound on this is awesome too! Can't wait to watch a Blu Ray on it.

Reviews.Title: Spend a Bit More...It'll Be Worth It
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I purchased LG 42LK450 for $525 from Amazon. It is the first HDTV I purchased, but I have spent very much (too much) time in front of HDTVs thanks to family and roommates. I try to research products thoroughly before making a purchase, and after reading reviews everywhere I could find them I decided to purchase this television. For under $600 USDs I did not expect a spectacular TV, I expected a pretty solid picture that would handle my gaming habit and the occasional DVD/Blu-ray.Assembly of the television was very simple, requiring 8 screws to attach it to the stand. Two of the screws seemed to be the wrong thread and did not tighten as much as they should have, as a result the TV leaned forward slightly (not enough to bother me.)I'll skip initial impressions and finish up with my overall opinion:I used the TV for a week predominantly playing XBOX 360 hooked up via HDMI before deciding to return the TV. Despite tweaking all the video settings (and they are fairly extensive) the picture quality was not what I had hoped. Images were washed out, and overall unclear.I decided to replace it with the LG 42LK520, which has 120Hz, a slightly higher contrast ratio, and TrueMotion support. The LK520 was $610 on Amazon, and was absolutely worth the extra $85.Even if you are looking for a budget(I assume you are if you are looking at a $600 LCD) SPEND THE LITTLE BIT EXTRA to get the next step up (42LK520, IT IS WORTH IT.

Reviews.Title: 32-inch LG HDTV is high style
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Hoogs "Early 60's Zealot"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I purchased this hi-def LG TV for our NJ condo, which we rent out during the summer season -- the smallish size fit our smallish living room perfectly and the price (419) was right ... it arrived in several days and we set it up for renters due to arrive in a few days.  It was a little tricky fitting the table stand pieces together (not as easy e.g., as the Vizio or Olevia TV stands -- talking about the "feet" and platform that snap onto the TV chassis to enable it to stand on a table). But my wife figured it out.  The set up was an expected breeze, the remote worked perfected, and the HD picture was as good as any I've seen. Also, there is an easy aspect-ratio selection feature, so you can watch 4:3 movies in their original framing instead of having the picture drawn out to 16:9, which makes everyone look fat.The one issue that could be improved here is the sound-system.  We do not have an external home theatre set-up in the condo, so we used the TV's sound; unfortunately, the speakers are located on the bottom side of the screen -- i.e., pointed downward toward the TV table.  That obscures the sound a bit, makes the volume lower than if the speakers faced out -- worse, the TV volume is not very powered, which means the volume cannot be cranked up as loud as one might want.  LG obviously adopted this design to improve the appearance of the unit -- and it works!  The set is beautiful -- (no visible built-in speakers to mar the appearance!) In our small unit we wouldn't want to play the TV overly loud anyway -- so as not to bother neighbors.  And, in any event, the sound situation would be improved by hooking it up to a home theatre.

Reviews.Title: Great TV...Minor Issue!
Reviews.Author: koyamike
Reviews.Content: Purchased from Amazon July 13, 2011 -Great LCD TV. Fits my son's small room just fine.The only issue just popped up...the TV started going OFF by itself. Wiggle the power cord (in back) and TV came back ON. Found the LG supplied power cord to be flaky...too loose of a fit for the plug on back of TV. Used a spare computer power cord...so far no more power issues.Otherwise, looks great, great picture and good sound quality.Took one star off for the power cord issue...this should be a non-issue in electronics.

Reviews.Title: lshkrh
Reviews.Author: K. Huntington
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for my downstairs man-cave.  I have an Xbox 360, and a Wii hooked up to it, along with a surround sound and a satellite receiver.  Picture quality is excellent.  What can I say it's great and at a great price also.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV!!! BAAAAADDD Amazon!
Reviews.Author: Stranded in Salt Lke
Reviews.Content: First a word about Amazon. I purchased this TV on September 12th and elected FREE Supersaver shipping. Amazon said they shipped it on September 15th, three days later. But somehow Fedex didn't receive it until September 19th, one WEEK later. Amazon said it would be delivered on September 21st. So, I took the day off from work. NO delivery. Fedex said it would be delivered September 23rd, so I took ANOTHER day off from work. It was finally delivered late in the afternoon on September 23rd, 11 days after I purchased it. So, aside from Kindle purchases which come electronically, this is my LAST experience making purchases from Amazon.Now, the TV:First, as others have said, the packaging is VERY flimsy and not suitable for Fedex/UPS shipment. Mine arrived with several punctures in the shipping carton. I made sure to note damages when I signed the Fedex shipping receipt. LG should upgrade the packaging of their TVs since their current packaging is simply NOT suitable for Fedex/UPS shipping.The printed manual that comes with the TV is a generic manual that covers about 30 models that LG makes; LCD,LED,Plasma and 3D. So, finding assembly instructions for your particular model is very difficult, and in order to save space in the manual, the instructions and drawings that you will find for your model are brief, primitive and useless. Have someone handy around when you try to assemble the stand. And, have a long-throat Phillips screwdriver available. The operating instructions are also primitive, generic and unuseful.Having said all of this, this is a GREAT TV! I've waited to post this in order to allow 12 hours of burn in. But from the get-go, the picture is FANTASTIC!!! Rich, detailed and vibrant with very good depth. Flesh-tones are AMAZING. The most accurate and vivid flesh-tones I have ever seen on any TV. I find flesh-tones to be the achilles heel of most any TV, but the LG is EXCELLENT in this regard right out of the box. Overall, the picture is simply outstanding using the standard settings without even using the PictureWizard calibration aid. As others have suggested:1) Turn off Auto Energy Savings2) Select "Just Scan" for aspect ratio3) I find the "Standard" picture settings to be more appealing than the "Cinema" setting (which I find to be too dark). The Standard settings are perfect!The sound is OUTSTANDING!!! Much better than I could have ever imagined from in-set speakers. I've selected the "ClearVoice II" enhancement at a level of 3, and I'm blown away with how good this thing sounds.I AM a sports fan and I'm watching Notre Dame beat Pitt right now. Even with the 60hz refresh, the picture is crisp and clear. While I'm  sure that the 120hz 42LK520 is lovely, save yourself $120 and get the 42LK450. You won't regret it and the savings will pay for a week or two of beer.The remote is very well organized and intuitive. It is equipped with Simplink so it'll control not only your TV but any LG dvd/blue-ray player as well.I have NO idea how TV this will hold up. I am VERY HAPPY with it at purchase. If it tanks, I'll let you know.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV
Reviews.Author: Jesse Barnes
Reviews.Content: Just unboxed this TV and have been setting it up.  The picture calibration tool is fairly nice, and so far things look good on the display.The back panel connectors seem a bit cheap though in the sense that they're not mounted very firmly to the chassis.  When I plugged in an HDMI cable, the whole connector board flexed a bit, though not enough to push the connectors all the way in to the chassis.  Given that connector changes aren't very frequent, this probably isn't a big deal, but they could have used a few more screws and mounting stands to hold this important bit of the board to the back cover.Overall, the TV is very light, which is nice now that I have to move it around and put it into my entertainment center.  Looking forward to seeing how Blu-Ray movies look on this thing...

Reviews.Title: No Regrets!
Reviews.Author: Stagr "Dc0199"
Reviews.Content: After several months of research, it came down to Samsung and LG. The reason we decided to go with this TV was because it was bigger, cheaper and looked better than the Samsung side by side. The reviews were all positive and the contrast ratio on the LG is better than the Samsung. Trust me, contrast ratio makes a big difference. After powering it up, my brother in law even commented how clear and nice the picture was WITHOUT HD. This is coming from an owner of a Samsung Magnolia TV owner and would be the first to tell me if it looked like crap :)

Reviews.Title: It's really 4.5 stars, nice TV!
Reviews.Author: Musio "musio"
Reviews.Content: OK - here we go, I'll try to be short and sweet about it:For what it's worth - I'm a basic TV watcher - different shows, some sports (NFL, NHL), movies, etc. I'm not a gamer, nor use this for my PC (although that must look really cool).Had this TV (42") for a week, and it's great!I was nervous that it was going to get banged up during shipping, but it was perfect when it arrived.Assembly was easy - took about 15 minutes. Make sure to lay out all of your assembly pieces out beforehand, just to be sure you have everything. You have to lay thescreen face down during assembly, so be careful! It's not super heavy, but get someone to help you, if needed.You will need a phillips screwdriver that has a long enough shaft to reach one of the holes from the top (actually bottom) of the mounting plate. The rear plate portion of the stand has a hole - this is so you can permanently mount it using the stand as opposed to mounting on a wall, if desired (a wood screw is included for this purpose).If I may pause for a moment: I see many other reviewers complaining about this TV's picture and sound. I have to ask, since you try to come off as some diva audio/video-phile, why didn't you just go for the top of the line Sony Bravia's, and be done with it? What do expect for under $500?Back to the TV: Features - too many to list. I used the picture calibrator to "set up" the tv. The Intellisensor option works well, but occasionally, I will switch it to'Vivid', depending on the channel/show/movie, etc. I basically let the TV do the work via auto settings as much as possible. Works nice for me!Picture - sharp and clear for a 60Hz. I have an HD cable box and use one of the HDMI ports. Looks great! The non-HD channels look decent, but that is about it. Just for the heck of it, I hooked up an antenna and did an auto-channel search. The 'on-air' HD broadcasts looked excellent. As far as picture adjustments go, I too, turned off the energy-saver feature; while I appreciate the idea of it, the picture was just a little too dark. Perhaps they will improve this in the future.Sound - it sounds great! I don't know why people are complaining about this? Sure, connect it up to a surround system - that is ideal. But the TV's speakers themselves sound fine.Let's see, what else... oh yeah, the model I received has the number "CUSYLH". Some people want to know this information. Something about what kind of screen panel it is?The screen itself is matte, but has a slight glossy look to it. While it does a good job of eliminating glare, there can still be some reflection from windows/lamps/lights, etc, but it's OK.The *only* thing I do not like, is the brown colored trim running across the lower portion of the frame. This definitely cheapens the look of the tv. I see where LG was going with it, but it looks dumb. It has four colors of brown (dark to light). It looks like an old 16bit gradient - not smooth, but blocky.All in all, this TV is a great buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: photodragon
Reviews.Content: I got this TV as a black Friday sale.  I must say I got an amazing bargain.  This TV has a beautiful display.  The usual presets don't do it justice though.  It comes with a self calibration utility.  Use it and the picture turns from good to top notch!  I have it connected to a media pc and watch mostly DVDs and HD.  I had trouble getting readable text on the desktop, but with some tweaking its acceptable.  Color rendition seems surprisingly very accurate, not over saturated like on most flat panels (except maybe the high end ones).  I dont use the sound at all so can't comment on it.  I couldn't imagine buying this kind of TV and only use its speakers, I have it connected to digital 5.1 as it should be.  As you can see in my setting below, there are plenty for you to tweak til your hearts content. I've not seen this kind of control since my CRT HDTV!In short, I highly recommend this TV if you are looking for a great HDTV but not over the top on price.My settings:backlight 50contrast  81brightness 80h sharpness 10v sharpness 40color  51tint  0dynamic contrast offNR offdigital NR offblack level lowcolor Gamut standardedge enhancer offcolor filter offcolor temp mediumgamma 2.2method 2 pointspatter outerall color contrast 0all color brightness 0color managment 0sI will likely change these as i get accustomed to the display.

Reviews.Title: You'll like the look
Reviews.Author: Richard Rotella "barritone"
Reviews.Content: I'm a Panasonic Plasma guy because its the blackest picture out there but there are no 32" plasma tv's so the best 32 at under 500 (amazon under 400) is LG 32LK450 32-Inch 1080p . don't let anyone say there is no difference between 720 and 1080. 1080 has twice the quality of 720 and if you can't see that then buy the cheapest tv you can find. This tv is for those who like and appreciate a good picture. Don't expect great sound from any monitor, that's why there are surround sound systems. Oh, and go with Onkyo receivers, they're the best for the buck.

Reviews.Title: Great television.
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I ordered the LG 42LK450 42 inch lcd television based on numerous consumer reviews and ratings.  We wanted a larger television for the master bedroom and had decided a 42 inch was the perfect size.The television was delivered in perfect shape.  Unpacking,  wall mounting,  and set up were quite simple.  The remote control is easy to use and almost intuitive.  Menu screens are the best I've ever seen.  Unlike many menu screens the LG has screens that do not require a genius to understand.  In most cases I did not even need to refer to the manual to figure them out.Picture quality is excellent.Can't speak to reliability since I just started using the television but am certainly am very impressed thus far.

Reviews.Title: Great TV set overall
Reviews.Author: LMO
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great picture for a 32" LCD TV (it looked as good as other non-LED sets in the store). The screen is not glossy. Good black color. Ability to turn off display (when playing music, for instance). Relatively good sound (it still needs a sub-woofer, but it is ok, especially if you raise bass/treble). Can be used as a computer monitor (good, but not great picture using a VGA cable; better with a DisplayPort to HDMI cable, but couldn't make it work at 1080p 60hz). It has headphone 3.5mm audio output and 3 HDMI inputs. USB port for music and video files, although it doesn't accept lossless audio. TV can be rotated sideways up to 20 degrees on the stand.Cons: The automatic screen adjustment is not customizable (I wish it was brighter than whatever it selects; but you can turn off the automatic adjustment, so not a problem). No button for on/off captions (you have to go through the not-so "quick menu", requiring 4 or more commands). My previous Sharp TV had a smaller remote (3/4 size) and was more functional (the TV menu organization was better too). The stand could be better (TV wobbles on the stand when you touch the TV; not a problem if you never touch it or hang the TV on the wall). The stand was also harder to install than I expected (the manual doesn't explain very well and you need a long screwdriver).It seems like I got a VA panel (product code CUSDLH), but I don't dislike it (perhaps the IPS is better, but this VA is not bad even from a 45 degree viewing angle).

Reviews.Title: Great TV! Great Price!!
Reviews.Author: mj
Reviews.Content: Had to mess with the settings a bit when I first turned it on but now the picture is great! Easy set up and settings adjustment. I'm not very technical and it was a breeze for me! Sounds awesome. Overall great tv 5/5 stars

Reviews.Title: Great TV...
Reviews.Author: R. Iyer
Reviews.Content: For its price, this is an excellent TV, and I can recommend it without reservation. I've been using it as a huge monitor with my Mac, and it works really well. The video quality on HD movies is very good, with excellent colors and very deep blacks. I don't find any issues with the 60 Hz TV, no judder or blurring at all.The calibration tool was excellent, and very easy to use.I also like that this TV is very light, which should make transporting it easy.

Reviews.Title: A Great TV
Reviews.Author: mczimmz
Reviews.Content: This tv is great. Picture in HD is amazing. gave 4 stars because picture quality in Standard Definition isn't as great. it more blurry. Its just a minor setback. Sound quality is good. Sort of sounds like your typical computer speakers. I do like the interface. You can easily set it up to your liking.I did have a problem getting it to connect to my PS3. it would get sound, but no video. It took some time to get picture on my AV cords. If on a PS3, if your going to use a AV cord instead of an HDMI cord, it will be somewhat of bad quality. With all these setbacks, Its still a great tv for the price.Would I buy it again?...Yes.

Reviews.Title: It keeps getting worse...
Reviews.Author: Tinker
Reviews.Content: In general, this is a good TV - and I've been through five in the past month looking for a decent set.  The picture is pleasing, and a CCFL-LCD picture seems to suit my eyes better than seeing the "sparklies" on LED-LCD panels.  It may not have the latest-and-greatest technology, but it looks extremely good to me.But I can't seem to get the sound to sync-up to the picture, it's just a tad behind the image on the screen.  It doesn't matter if it's from a disc, from satellite, over the internet, or from local broadcasts; you see the lips move a heartbeat before hearing the words.  A bit disconcerting.I have shut off everything in the Sound menu, wondering if pre-processing was the problem, but haven't had any luck so far.  Have also reset the TV to factory defaults without solving it, and even tried to run it in store demo mode.  All the same.Has anyone else seen this?  Is there a solution?What I like most about LG televisions:1. Swivel stands.  LG puts a swiveling stand on almost all their televisions, and that's a perfect option for a 32-inch set.2. Programmable off-time.  You can program an LG to turn itself off (or on) at the same time every day, without any additional information.  When the television is in a bedroom, this is an extremely convenient feature - much better than a sleep timer.  Although the sets also have normal sleep timers, we like the programmed off-time much better.3. I can turn off the LED status lights.  I can turn off the standby (red-colored) LED, or I can turn off the power-on (green-colored) LED, or I can turn them both off.  Or leave them on... I never understood how anyone thought it was a good idea to have a bright red LED on when you turn off the television, especially at night, in a bedroom.  I can turn the standby LED off and leave the power-on LED alone and get a good night's sleep.  Great feature, infinitely better than partially dimming the LEDs.  Seems to be unique to LG.UPDATE: I asked for a replacement because of the audio problems and OMG!  Could it get any worse!?  Somehow the original had the IPS panel and the replacement has a VA panel.  Maybe it's just this one panel, but you have to be dead-on center to see the picture.  Left or right, high or low, and the side of the panel opposite from you is washed-out (Yes, it's calibrated).LG swaps in lower-quality panels every so often, apparently at whim.  I never thought about it because they swear all LCD panels they use meet the same specifications.  Hardly.This isn't an issue of response time for playing games.  I don;t play games.  The issue is that one person on one side of the bed sees a great picture, the person on the other side sees half a picture.Amazon had this problem with LG last year in the LE5300-series, and it's just a crap shoot.  I'm not happy with how Amazon is handling this at the moment - they're being a bit cranky - but I'm close to reaching thermonuclear critical mass with LG.It's just anything for a buck and none of us should take it.  Down 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV regardless of the excellent price!
Reviews.Author: pk11687
Reviews.Content: I, of course, bought this lcd tv because of the excellent price and the above average reviews. After receiving it and enjoying it, I wouldn't switch to a new tv for more money because I really wouldn't need to. The picture is great and it would seem pointless to sink more money into something else. Sure, maybe I could get something "better", but I would probably have to spend twice as much for tiny little improvements.Really though, this tv is great. I can understand the gripes from some people receiving a television that doesn't work, but rejects happen everywhere, and you just have to hope yours isn't one of them. Thankfully, as far as my experience goes, I honestly couldn't ask more from a tv. I didn't care about getting one with internet capability, so if that is what you want, go with something else. However, if you want a television with great picture and above average sound, go with this. The price seems to be the best out of all the rest, and I can't see how most could ask for more. I would recommend a sound system to get the most out of it, but it's not as if the sound is horrid. I'm simply saying that if you care alot about sound, I don't think this will meet your needs completely.On a side note: You will need to mess with the sound and picture settings to get the best experience, but in my opinion, that should be expected. After all, what other electronic device agrees with everyone's expectations before a little "tweaking".Here's my two cents: After reading all about this television on amazon, realizing what features came with this tv and what didn't, my only concern was whether or not the picture would meet my entertainment desires. Rest assured that along with the several other happy customers, it did indeed meet them. So, do yourself a favor and buy it!

Reviews.Title: zero complaints
Reviews.Author: abirdmn
Reviews.Content: I love mine!  I bought it for the bedroom. I have had it for a month as I write this.  Use it daily.It was very easy to set up and program.  I have only had to adjust one setting from the factory default to improve the clarity of the picture, but it was totally watchable before I did that as well. (granted I did this all on my own, no hubby required!!) I do not have this tv attached to dish or cable.  I have a digital antenna on it and it is just a clear and perfect as the tv on dish in the living room.  Granted, I live in the metro area of a major city however.I have zero complaints in regards to the sound, picture or price!  And it shipped in perfect condition.

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly Good TV
Reviews.Author: Janet Cochrane
Reviews.Content: This is a surprise for the price, the LG 32" 1080 TV produces a terrific picture, sound not so great - kind of tinny but it does not matter because the picture is so good,  I found the instructions to set up the stand a little difficult to follow but once I figured it out, everything else in the setup went smoothly.I would give this TV a 5 if the speakers and sound were a bit better - the picture and options for cable/satellite, DVD, computer hookups more than enough to handle my media viewing needs.

Reviews.Title: Great TV so far
Reviews.Author: Mike "Mike"
Reviews.Content: So far I'm a big fan of this TV.  I kept an eye on the listing on Amazon and then saw it in a retail store.  It looked better than most other sets in the size range.  For some reason, 37" TVs don't seem to be stocked very well in stores anymore.  The picture is way better than 37" Samsung TVs that I have seen.  They were the other brand that I was considering.  The Amazon price is about $30 less for this model than at Best Buy (As of July 2011).At first, the TV looked really dark, but when I found the environmental/screen brightness option the picture became perfect.  The cable HD picture is really great through the HDMI port.  Standard def isn't as nice, but that's typical with all TVs I believe.  I don't have BluRay, so I can't really review how they look.  I bought this TV when my comparable Vizio died after 13 months.  This is a great TV for the price.  It looks better than many more expensive TVs as well.

Reviews.Title: TV with great customer service
Reviews.Author: Oni
Reviews.Content: I ordered my TV about a month ago and the night I got it after 6 hours of use the screen died. Black, dead, no picture whatsoever though the sound still worked. I called LG the very next day and rather than have me ship my TV to them for repair they sent a repair guy out to my home to diagnose and fix my TV. The appointment was 4 days after the call was made and they diagnosed that I needed a new screen panel. 2 and a half weeks later they come back with the new screen panel and replace it with no hassle and are in and out in 20 minutes. The parts and the repair service was covered entirely by LG under they're Manufacturer's Warranty and I didn't pay a cent towards it getting repaired.The TV itself is a great item with vivid picture and is perfect for what I use it for, a desk top home entertainment system in a bedroom. LG delivers with it's electronics like Cellphones and home appliances, I am glad to see the same quality and dedication in their TV sets as well.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: zaydia
Reviews.Content: This is my first HDTV and I couldn't be happier. I wanted a basic no-frills TV when my old CRT died. I didn't need internet connectivity or any other bells and whistles - just a TV, and this delivered. The size is perfect (42") big, but doesn't overwhelm my living room. I also was a big fan of the door-to-door delivery, which meant I didn't have to wrestle it upstairs by myself.  The color and picture is great. One thing that wasn't mentioned in the description (and is a feature I love) is that there is an ambient light sensor that automatically adjusts the brightness according to the room lighting, so that it doesn't burn your retinas out when the sun goes down. LOVE THAT!

Reviews.Title: Best Picture for the Price!!!
Reviews.Author: Keith
Reviews.Content: I had done a lot of research for a TV for my new apartment before finally deciding on this TV. I wanted something large, affordable, and with a great picture. This TV has all of that. This TV has one of the best pictures I've ever seen, it's better than any other 40 inch I've seen setup at any of the department stores. With that being said I did adjust the picture a bit when I first got it (which is super easy to do and there are tons of options for tweaking).Pros: Incredible Picture, Great Built in Speakers, Super Cheap, Excellent Viewing AnglesCons: Only 2 HDMI ports, Only audio out is Optical Digital (Both of these haven't affected me, but I figured I'd be fair).Bottom Line: If you're looking for a 40" TV with a great picture for super cheap then LOOK NO FURTHER!

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: Mark Twain
Reviews.Content: price is good for the size. We have bought the 32 inch 32LD350 and we loved it so we bought another LG product. This TV looks great except for a minor dark corner borders about 3 inches in, although it's not really that noticable.The intelligent sensor is great for at night. It'll seem really dark at first but it takes about 5 minutes for your eyes to get used to it and is very pleasant on the eyes (at first you'll be thinking that it's so dark, how can you see anything, but just try it for 5 minutes). Try turning it back on to standard and it'll look so bright that it gets uncomfortable.I'm a novice at calibrating the TV but the built-in self calibration wizard is great, it looks a lot better than the standard settings.

Reviews.Title: Best Purchase I've made so far
Reviews.Author: Xbox 360 Gamer
Reviews.Content: I was looking strictly for a T.V. that I wouldn't have to worry about input lag from while playing xbox 360 games like CoD: Black Ops or Battlefield games. The quality of picture is great. I have zero input lag that I can tell. Exactly what I was looking for as a gamer. Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Stunning Picture
Reviews.Author: Lawrence Reilly "lreilly28"
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is absolutely gorgeous! I can't say enough about the sharpness and clarity of this TV. When I first turned on the TV the picture was too dark but that was remedied by adjusting the energy saving feature to off or low. Assembly was about 10 minutes and simple. The real problem I had was the remote! After hooking up the TV to my cable box (HDMI) I found I was unable to use the (TV) function of the remote and instead had to use one of the HDMI inputs which caused me to lose some of the functionality of the LG remote. Instead I decided to run the TV with my cable box remote. Except for the remote problem I would have given this review a 5. One thing I wasn't prepared for was how good my standard DVDs looked on this set. I also noticed that even the non-HI-DEF channels look great on this box. The sound is perfect and I can detect no problem with high motion video or sports. When I turned on the set for the first time I noticed that it was set to a high contrast and brightness neither of which is needed so I lowered both by half and the picture is still great. For those hard to satisfy viewers there are plenty of picture adjustments to keep them happy. I worried about getting a TV by UPS but it arrived in perfect condition and is packed very sturdily. I also worried whether a 32" would be too small but for me it was just right. All in all-a good buy.

Reviews.Title: LG 37LK450
Reviews.Author: Jesse Roberts
Reviews.Content: I went and picked the tv up from Best Buy to ensure I got an IPS panel, look on the box for the "Y" version "CUSY" for the IPS. The picture is great, there's no noticeable input lag in MW3 on my Xbox 360. I researched all day before I made a decision and went out and bought this, I wanted the least amount of input lag possible for the price and this is it.. if you get the IPS panel. The colors are very good, but the blacks aren't as dark as they could be. The viewing angle is pretty good on the IPS, colors stay the same even from an extreme angle, although you'll see the white backlight more, still very much viewable. The built-in speakers are better than I expected, of course not great they're very decent and fine for light TV watching. My standard def DirecTV connected with composite cables looks pretty bad, I expected this though. It seems no newer tvs have S-video unfortunately, so I'm forced to watch TV and play older consoles through composite.. It does have 2 individual composite inputs (not linked to component), 2 component, 3 HDMI, USB, RF, VGA, digital and optical outputs, and a 3.5mm output. Other than the standard definition and black levels, I love this tv and I recommend it to anybody who wants a tv for gaming with little to NO input lag..BUT, be sure to go into the shop and get the "Y" version with an IPS panel, I've heard the VA panels lag substantially more and have worse viewing angles.  Note: I have my Xbox 360 connected through component at the moment, running 1080p with no lag in 60FPS games.. I have yet to try HDMI but I should have a cable coming soon and I expect it to be lagless.

Reviews.Title: Good buy for the money, but not great.
Reviews.Author: DanInAustin
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about 8 months, and I certainly have mixed feelings about it.The good:at 42", it's plenty big for my apartment. With a bit of tweaking, the picture quality is decent.The bad:Out of the box, the picture quality is terrible. Take the time to calibrate it!It's a 60 Hz TV, and the difference between this and a 120 Hz is quite noticeable.The backlighting is inconsistent around the edges.The black levels are nothing to write home about.The sound is appalling. Seriously, if you're planning to use this without external speakers, think again.If you're using analog audio from your cable box, the display lag is noticeable. This could be the cable box's fault, though.Basically, I wish I'd spent a few bucks more and gotten something nicer, but I'm not kicking myself for buying it, because I got a good price.

Reviews.Title: Surprised how nice this LG TV is.
Reviews.Author: Jim Pierce
Reviews.Content: I'm typically a Samsung LED family but I wanted to buy my parents a new TV for Christmas that would fit on their stand so I lQQked for a 37". Didn't want a cheapo model as they deserve better but didn't want to go for my lungs cause what you do for your parents you have to do for your in-laws. There weren't many choices as I hear most TV companies are either cutting way back or getting rid of their 37" models. Such a shame since this size fits in and on many TV consoles nicely with out having to reduce down to a 32" and the 4" as in my case was to big.Any way I did my D&D; on this LG and spoke to my brother-in-law who installs cable in homes who gave it a thumbs up.So I ordered it from Amazon at a better price then best buy or any other place I could find on Thursday and was delivered on Saturday just in time to wrap for Christams.Once you install the 8 screws in the stand it was just plug and play. I set this TV up in a matter of 15 minutes. What great picture quality and the volume was way better then I had thought.I have some very happy parents. I would recommend this TV to anyone. I don't see any flaws.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Aaron Eady
Reviews.Content: Just got the tv today. I love the picture and sound. I have my cable box(wow), computer, xbox, wii, and surround sound all hooked up to it. I was worried about the 60Hz but it is great. If you buy this tv I really don't think you will regret it. I was not sure 42" was going to be big enough but it is actually a big tv, very light too(40lbs). I carried it up the stairs by myself. I am excited to get the wall mount tomorrow. Hope this helps you out.~Aaron

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: I had only one problem with the TV, there were red horizontal streaks that flashed on the screen every several minutes or so.The streaks flash fairly quickly, but just long enough for my eyes to catch them. (If you're red/green color blind like myfriend, you may not even see them!)I called LG and they said it could be my cable, but ended up being the TV. They put me in contact with a local electronicsrepair store. They fixed my TV for free because it was still under manufacturers warranty.So, it was a bit of a pain, but ended up working well.I would buy this TV again, just because of the price!

Reviews.Title: First Time HD TV owner
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: Ordered the new TV on Sunday, had it the following Wednesday.  That's with the FREE Shipping!  Product arrived in perfect condition, so kudos to Amazon and UPS for such a speedy and safe delivery.This TV will be for the bedroom and looks very sharp on top of my large dressing cabinet.  I've read other reviews about some sort of "ugly" brown bar along the bottom of the TV?  I personally do not see it?  I know it's a matter of preference and everyone's different, but it's really barely noticable, unless you've fixated on it, I suppose.Plugged in the TV, attached to my rooftop antenna (I cut cable a while back), and did an autoscan for channels.  That took some time.  You need to go get a snack or do another project while you're waiting for that.  When it was finished, I had more channels than I've ever had with my still existing tube style tv and DTV converter box.  Maybe I just need to do a rescan with the old tv?  I got at least 50 - 60 channels, OTA.  I will definitely be editing some out because they're either too weak of a signal to watch, or in a language I don't understand.  What's confusing, is that there are DTV channels and TV channels (those are snowy - as in an old analog tv?).  Not sure I understand that, but they'll probably get deleted too.The picture quality in the OTA HD channels is quite good.  Some of the stations look as though they're broadcasting in 720p HD and some are in 1080i HD.  Haven't seen a 1080p yet?  I don't see a whole lot of difference between the 720p and 1080i.  I'm still waiting for my video streaming device to come in.  I'll most likely comment on any issues there.  I have 6M DSL service which tends to be more in the 4M realm.  I'm sure I'll be able to stream, but the quality may be lacking.  We'll see?  I haven't done any calibration yet, but will do soon, so I'm hoping the picture quality will only improve.Bottom line - Extremely happy with this 32" LCD HDTV.  Extremely happy with Amazon's service and the delivery.

Reviews.Title: Nice features yet SIMPLE
Reviews.Author: C. Jolls
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my 80 year old mother to use.  I've had excellent experiences with other LG products, and the price was exactly where I wanted it.  Being able to label the inputs so instead of AV1 and HDMI2, it says VHS, DVD and CABLE was a huge help for my mother.  The picture was beautiful and it was the first LCD TV I've purchased (I have other DLP TVs) and it really is amazing.  It's also in a room full of windows, but the picture was bright and clear with plenty of contrast, even with the picture control turned off.  Set to 'sports' it was even brighter and sharper.I can understand now why they have 120Hz TVs;  when viewing some content at 1080p (like a blu-ray of Avatar) I could see a sort of flicker when the camera would pan, or especially during the space CGI scenes.  I assume a 120Hz or higher TV would eliminate that, or hide it better.  I'm just usually very sensitive to these things, (I see rainbows on the DLP, for example) plus my mother will only be watching HD content on cable.  I doubt she'd notice or be able to distinguish the difference between 60 and 120Hz.  My wife didn't notice it, even when it was at it's worse for me.It's an excellent TV.  When my DLP dies I'll buy a new LG to replace it.

Reviews.Title: Energy Saver makes for a dark screen
Reviews.Author: Missoops
Reviews.Content: So far so good with this television.  The energy saving feature, however, makes the screen very dark.  To get a vivid picture, you need to turn energy saving either off or down to minimum, then it is very sharp.  Assembly and set up was no problem for me.  I like that the screen can be swiveled side to side.  The on-tv controls are conveniently located on the top, and there are both side and back ports for AV connections.  I haven't used the USB function yet, but I'm glad they have that option.

Reviews.Title: My first 1080p Venture
Reviews.Author: reallyme07
Reviews.Content: "I deal with boatloads of tvs of everyday, especially working for a broadband and tv provider. The main thing that caught me on this was the price. My old one had blacked out and I need a new one stat! I was not expecting to get 1080p in my budget so I was surprised to see this one sitting there. The store demo did not do it an ounce of justice. This LCD outperform nearly all of my expectations. The picture is crystal clear from all of my high definition sources. My only gripe is the lack of internet connectivity or apps (which I admittedly can get from the devices already hooked up to it) and that the refresh is only 60hz, but the for the price that may be asking to much, lol! I highly recommend this set for any first-time HDTV buyer on a budget!"

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased With Our First HD TV
Reviews.Author: Old Swamp Yank
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before I bought this TV.  We bought a Phillips 32" CRT about 7 years ago and after repairing it once to the tune of $200 (we initially paid $350 for), I decided it was time for a new TV.  We settled on this one.  We needed to get a DirectTV HD box in order to get HD out of it, but we already had the wiring and appropriate satellite so it was a no brainer.  In HD, this TV is spectacular.  At 42" it's huge.  The contrast is fantastic.  My mother came over for a visit and could not believe how incredible it looked.  In non-HD, it's very good if you set the screen ratio back down to 4:3.  A little bit of a pain but I imagine all HD-TV's will be the same.  If you walk into Walmart and look at what is on the wall, they all look awful in non-HD.  But with DirectTV-HD, almost everything I want to watch is in HD, I was actually surprised how much is in HD.  3-4 years ago, nothing was in HD.  The sound is good, it tops out a good bit quieter than our CRT did and the frequency response seems different, it has much less bass and more treble.  But it is certainly adequate.  I'm not interested in external speakers but if I want to be blown across the room I'm sure I could attach them.If I had to do it again, I would buy this TV.  Assuming it does not crap out in a month or a year, I'm thrilled.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Quality, Excellent Value, overall a brilliant viewing and listening experience!
Reviews.Author: Beshoy Latif "Canosmegos"
Reviews.Content: Update March 2012: Use the picture wizard in the menu.  It really fine tunes the image quality.Where do I start?  This LCD TV is replacing a 23" Samsung computer monitor that I have been using as an entertainment viewing screen in my bedroom.  As such is the case, I have been looking to make the purchase on a big screen TV for a long, long time.  This search came to a conclusion earlier this year when I found a deal on this TV.  Admittedly, what drew me to this purchase was the brand name and the gleaming reviews on multiple websites.This TV delivers excellent quality picture and sound.  The image is crisp and remarkably clear.  Color clarity is spectacular for this being a cathode back-lit model.  I find black levels to be perfect for my viewing needs.  I typically use this TV as a computer monitor for viewing film, regular HD television programs, gaming, and everyday internet browsing.One of the features I like the most is the picture image wizard.  You can quite literally set the picture features to your liking with a very easy to use step-by-step wizard.  Couple this with the automatic backlight setting, you get the best possible viewing experience.I read through dozens of reviews that were somewhat critical of the sound, but I should say this: for a 3" panel, the built in speakers outperform pretty much every other LCD panel I have seen in my search for a new TV.  The bass is present and acceptable for a normal listening experience, but won't compare to a separate audio system.  Regardless of that one minor and understandable drawback, I find that the clearvoice setting and infinite surround have the effect that I believe they were intended to achieve.  Clearvoice emphasizes and amplifies mid range audio frequencies where you will typically find vocal ranges.  Infinite surround also achieves a sort of surround sound effect.  Its not absolutely amazing like some of the new sound bars, but it is present and effective at some level.Long story short, I think if you get this TV you will be greatly pleased.  Granted that everyone's taste is different, I'm still quite certain that this TV offers up tunable video and audio performance that will appeal to even the most discerning video/audiophile.

Reviews.Title: Good value option
Reviews.Author: Spanman
Reviews.Content: The TV was offered by Amazon at the lowest price point about 4 weeks ago. The shipping was quick and uneventful except for damage to the flimsy LG packaging. The shipper had unboxed it and checked for damage to the contents. I was offered the option of refusing delivery for the mangled box. Setup was easy and also uneventful. If you are planning on using the digital tuner for over the air signals, it seems to be only mediocre. The picture is very good from an HD source. The sound thru the on board speakers is adequate. A full range of adjustments are possible, but I have stuck close to the defaults for the Cinema mode for both color and sound. The TV is good looking but I would have preferred a mat finish on the bezel. The brown trim strip on the bottom edge does not improve the look but those reviewers who are obsessing over it, probably need therapy. Overall, it's quite a good value and a satisfying purchase.

Reviews.Title: Best $300 I've spent in a long time
Reviews.Author: Jason Clontz
Reviews.Content: I picked this up as part of the Black Friday surge around Thanksgiving 2011.  It has worked flawlessly since I unboxed it.  It's absurdly light, but doesn't have a cheap feel to it.  The body doesn't easily flex, there are no rattling noises when moving it around and the picture quality is outstanding.If I had to write up cons for this device, the only two things I could think of are extremely minor.  In fact the first one doesn't apply if you're not using the stand.1) The wells that you have to screw the base into require a *very* long screwdriver to properly tighten 2 of the 4 screws, but if you mount the tv on a wall or backstand unit, this is a non-issue.2) The speakers are a bit weak by themselves.  There is practically no bass output from them, so you won't "feel the rumble" if you plan on just piping the sound into this set.  Using the audio out or running signal from a receiver in the first place will easily get around this.I'm currently using this as my monitor for my desktop PC.  There are absolutely no issues with ghosting when gaming or watching netflix.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Z Io
Reviews.Content: I really like this TV. It is my first flat panel television, and I'm glad I got this one. The picture is excellent for my xbox, and each video mode has its own settings. The only problem i really have is that the visual volume meter thing (when you change the volume this thing pops up) Is a blue and white circle in the bottom right corner, and i would have preferred just a bar somewhere. Other interface elements are well designed, understandable and easily modified. I used the setup guide included in the menu system in conjunction with a game disk to set my screen up so that all games are spectacular looking. Another feature i love is that i can stick a USB drive into the side and play video files, AND THIS TV READS THE MKV FORMAT!!! So thrilled about that! So far I've just used MKV and AVI. I've had this for a while now and nothing has caused me to freak or stress.

Reviews.Title: 42 Inch LK450 LG TV Review
Reviews.Author: Jscook
Reviews.Content: Just want to say how pleased I am with this TV. I spent a long time looking for the best deal on the "Bang for your Buck" HDTV. I am set up with a nice 3d blu-ray player and an xbox with an old Sony surround sound system. I could use even my old surround system with the optic cable, and have two different HDMI inputs for my blu-ray and XBOX so that I have surround all the time and never have to unplug cables. The picture quality goes from decent to very good after 12 hours of viewing. I think the picture quality on Netflix and regular movies is alright, and the Blu-rays are fantastic (obviously worth the 1080p vs 720p those who are debating those two). The sound with the TV by itself is ok (I read that it is better than most) and the settings are easy to mess around with. If you are looking to use this TV for yourself you will be MORE than happy I guarantee it. If you need to impress friends or loved ones that are intense critics or you yourself are a master of the HDTV world as many I read on here are then you should probably spend the extra money on a 120 hz or a top of the line TV. Hope this helps, btw LG has had great support so far for me for those who question that part of a company you are investing in. If you do buy the TV immediately turn off the energy saver and run movies for half a day. You're welcome in advance ;)

Reviews.Title: delivers a lot for the price
Reviews.Author: jean "jean"
Reviews.Content: i read the reviews and compared prices.  the closest i could come to this was a vizio at $60 more (at a warehouse club store).  i have a 32" vizio and it's great.  but i took a chance on this lg.  some of the negative reviews worried me.  (i always read them first!)delivered in less than a week -- free ship.easy to attach to the stand -- but the booklet (which covers multiple models) is not so much help.  so you read, look, intuit and do your best. turns out to be a stable stand and it swivels!liked that it has 2 separate AV receptors for composite cables -- red, yellow, green prongs.the picture was good and came on quickly. (tried out some optional settings, but like the default best.) no bad pixils, no problems.the negative reviews about some brown plastic strip along the bottom worried me beforehand.  LOL  NOT a problem!this 5 star review is incomplete:  the tv is new.  it needs to work just like new for years and years to really deserve the stars.  we'll see.  but it's off to a good start.  it delivers a lot for the money.

Reviews.Title: It's a Great Television
Reviews.Author: ROM_Tucson
Reviews.Content: I received our 42" LG in the morning and I didn't have time to set it up until that night..I tell what, once it found all the channels and we did all the settings..the first image channel was DIGITAL CABLE..wow !!!! We are nothing less than thrill, and made all the waiting for the right television, worth every minute of it..if you want a great television... man !! this one is the way to go...We Love it !!

Reviews.Title: Criticism of Black Levels Justified
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Grauer Kater"
Reviews.Content: I recently tested this TV.  I probably would have kept it if it had arrived intact, but it had been significantly damaged in shipping, and I went with a Sony Bravia 40" on my second chance.  I was still able to watch the LG TV and assess its picture quality.  (I'll keep my comment about shipping short, but beware that Amazon's Warehouse packing of TVs can be scary-silly, with no foam between the outside of a flimsy cardboard box and the screen. So--Amazon: use more foam!).Now--the aesthetics of this TV.  I encourage anyone interested in this TV to read the review at televisioninfo-dot-com.  There's a very detailed account there.  To summarize the review in one sentence: this TV has excellent color, but it has weak blacks.  I read the review before  I got the LG, and I thought the review might be knit-picking, but my in-person impression: the criticisms (echoed by CNET) are correct.  This may be a matter of taste; but I think most people like cinematic, high contrast capabilities in their TVs.  I think many people could still could make peace with this TV: it has, like most LGs, excellent build quality (until Amazons' packers and shippers crashed it) and picture adjustment menus.  The Bravia cost slightly more but has a crisper, higher-contrast image.

Reviews.Title: LG's are the best!!
Reviews.Author: Patrick Martinez
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these LG 32LK450 32 -Inch 1080p 60Hz LCD VA Panel HDTV.  They were Christmas gifts for our children.  They both are performing with clarity and without problems.  The fact that you can hook up your computer directly to the TVs is what our children like best.  I would reccommend this product to anyone looking for a very good TV with a great picture.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Price, but Poor Side Viewing
Reviews.Author: J. Gargiulo "Gardijon"
Reviews.Content: In short, this is a great TV for the price, but I should have read more reviews before purchasing.  I have a Samsung 1080p LCD and a Panasonic Viera 1080p LCD in my home and those TVs are also entry level LCD's like this LG one, but the main difference is the viewing area.  The image quality is great, but this LG Model's image quality suffers almost immediately when you venture away from sitting directly in front of it.  The Samsung and Panasonic TV's I have are totally viewable from 45 degrees from center.Don't get me wrong, this is still a good TV for the price, but for me the viewing angle degradation is enough for me to return this model and to purchase a comparably priced Samsung (LN40D550) or Panasonic (TC-L42U30).READ, READ, READ reviews before you purchase your TV, and not just the Amazon reviews!

Reviews.Title: great tv at any price
Reviews.Author: S. Hammond "suess"
Reviews.Content: We have this tv and also and lg led tv. We've had this one for about a yearafter a dismal experience in owning a Best Buy brand.  We couldn't be happier with this tv.  I would say this one has an even better picture than the LG led.  We're still tweaking the led one though so maybe it will be better.  I think the sound is good on this lcd, especially if you go into the menu and make some changes as others have suggested here.All in all I'm an LG believer.  Quality product at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Chris Ragazzo
Reviews.Content: Could not be happier. Ease of use, setup and picture quality is outstanding for the price.Do not worry about the techie specs, if you want a great HD SCREEN now,this is it.

Reviews.Title: Great picture at a great value
Reviews.Author: RPGINDC "rpg5c"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this LG on Black Friday for a great value to replace a Vizio LED that has been plagued with problems. Picture quality on the LG is better than Vizio even though this is not an LED.  I'm not very technical but this was very easy to set up, very easy to modify picture settings (it shows you how the picture would look if you change each aspect of the picture settings, which helps to select the one you like best), you can also easily customize picture settings for sports, or different personal preferences, sound options are also easy to change and you can hear the sound difference before selecting an option.  Using this in a bedroom so not our primary TV but so far extremely happy with the product, price and value from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good once you tinker with the video settings
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: I was super frustrated the first night I got this TV.  It DOES NOT have a DVI Port as expected, so it threw me a curve ball.  I use it primarily as a computer monitor, and wanted digital so the VGA was not going to work for me.  Luckily my graphics card has an HDMI port.  Once hooked up, it looked good but not great, turns out you need to make a custom resolution because the graphics card only thinks the tv can handle 30 hz, when in fact this is a 60hz set.  Even after all that, the colors were washed out, and the contrast was off, and it was dark, and no amount of tinkering could get it just right.I finally figured out, that this tv has a "feature" that locks you out of the back light brightness, that can be disabled.DISABLE THIS FEATURE, I know they put it in for the energy star, which this tv is, but your killing your viewing experience.  Plus, you cant darken the set late at night when you don't want a bright set if this feature is enabled.  It uses a sensor, which doesn't take into account your taste in brightness.USE THE PICTURE WIZARD.  This thing actually work pretty well, use it to get the settings pretty much perfect after you disable the Energy SavingsReally happy in the end, as often times on larger screens, clarity gets lost

Reviews.Title: LG 32" LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Allan L. Culliver
Reviews.Content: This TV was placed in a small (12.5 x 13') bedroom. The size is perfect for the room and while I was concerned about sound volume before ordering the set, I was pleasantly surprised with its audio performance. Great TV for my purpose.

Reviews.Title: Pretty darn nice
Reviews.Author: Pampered Prepper
Reviews.Content: We got this tv a while back from another company but i mean this price is amazing, and if that isnt enough its a fantastic tv....The picture is clear and the sound is great. We have like not a super small living room but its not huge either...so this tv is Perfect next is the bedroom for this price..highly recommended,i send everyone to amazon for this tv!!

Reviews.Title: Great picture,great TV
Reviews.Author: deadpoet01
Reviews.Content: I've had the LG for a couple of months. I never have had a problem, this TV is user friendly, and easy to use. I've got HD cable service and a Blu Ray player, and the picture is great. I would recommend this LG to anyone who is looking for a good TV at a good price.

Reviews.Title: fantastic television!
Reviews.Author: Nicholas J Kreucher "Nick"
Reviews.Content: Using with Linux, DVI + audio cables for MythTV on a machine w/o hdmi out. The HDMI 1 input will use the separate analog audio input, which is perfect for DVI->HDMI cables.Great color, intelligent auto brightness/contrast, easy yet powerful menu, very cool front panel touch sensitive controls.Be sure to set aspect ratio to "just scan" if you're having problems with getting it to display native resolution correctly via DVI etc.

Reviews.Title: Love This T.V.!
Reviews.Author: Sasha
Reviews.Content: Great color, great picture and the perfect size for my entertainment center.  Only complaint is that you can't manually adjust the color and can only choose from a few pre-set selections such as vivid or standard.  LG has other models available where you can manually adjust the color to your liking and wish I knew before purchasing this model that this wasn't one of them.

Reviews.Title: Great 1080p LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Bob B "Bob B"
Reviews.Content: This 32LK450 is our 2nd LG LCD TV, and both have been great.  While I think all 1080p LCD TVs have a really good picture, I like the LG Menu options better than other LCD TVs I have owned.  One nice feature is independent Picture and Sound settings for each input device.  Another is the Sound level control and Voice enhancement features, both of which work well; we can really tell the difference when it is missing on TVs when we travel.  Owning LG Blu Ray players, it is nice to have remotes that work both TV and player, and a sync'd start feature so turning on the Blu Ray/DVD starts the TV and sets it to Blu Ray/DVD.  Overall, a great LCD TV for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Good tv
Reviews.Author: Zhang yusi
Reviews.Content: I like this tv it just fit my room and the picture is good I can use this to play games and watch a video I like this tv

Reviews.Title: Terrific HDTV
Reviews.Author: Roy Nakahara
Reviews.Content: The LG HDTV arrived promptly and was packed very well.  Assembly was quick and easy.  The setup was simple.  This LG HDTV is being used as both a PC monitor and a TV.  This replaces a 30-inch PC monitor that went bad.  When used as a PC monitor, the images are very good and considered to be highly satisfactory.  When used as a HDTV, the HDTV programs are excellent, almost as good as my larger screen LED LCD TV.  Highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: LG LK450 32inch 1080p
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: This TV has an excellent picture, it is easy to set up, and the remote control is easy to manipulate (one of the easiest I've ever dealt with).  One complaint is on the internal speakers.  I've had a few 32-44 inch LCD TV's and I understand that their speakers aren't meant to "blow you away" but they have always been adequate.  This LG is on the very low end of adequate for its speaker.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price.... but the table base is a pain
Reviews.Author: Dave from Tacoma
Reviews.Content: The TV itself is great - love it.  Works perfectly at a great priceand couldn't be happier.But just a warning to anyone without mechanical skills.  The table topbase requires assembly (8 screws) and the instructions are pretty horridfor someone who doesn't do mechanical things often.  I had no problemswith it - but it's just the most involved table base I've ever seenfor a flat panel.  They really "over thought" this one... confusingassembly.So if you aren't mechanically inclined - assembling multiple piecesand dealing with 8 screws, 2 of which are more difficult becauseof being recessed, you may want to look at another TV.I had no problems but can see where some folks would.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!  No Complaints!
Reviews.Author: beckaroony
Reviews.Content: I love this TV!  The most amazing looking movie I've watched on it is Avatar on Blu-Ray.  The colors are so rich!  I also use it as a computer monitor.  So I can watch anything from the internet in HD.  Make sure you only purchase 1080p.  720p costs less, but it's not true HD.
