Watching Blu-rays with 720p is pointless because you won't get the full HD quality.  In my opinion it's just a marketing scam.  You'll have to decide if 60 Hz or 120 Hz is for you.  If you get a 120 Hz, make sure it has the option to switch to 60 Hz.  I read a lot of reviews on televisions before I bought this one.  Some people complained that they couldn't stand watching movies on 120 Hz TVs because you can lose that movie effect.  It looks like you're watching live TV.  I've watched movies like that on other TVs and I can't stand it!  It's like watching the local news on TV.  Why would you want a movie to look like that?  That's why movies are filmed with filters on the camera.  To give it that professional movie quality.  Plus the TV signal is only 60 Hz (I think).  120 Hz is good for live sports.  Lots of fast live action.  It's good for fast movement.  If I was to spend a little more money, I think I would have got Sony's Bravia.  It has almost impeccable reviews.  It has great options too.  You won't be disappointed with this LG though.  I've owned 4 or 5 Lg products and have never had problems.  I would recommend the LG brand.

Reviews.Title: Great larger tv for the price - not too heavy
Reviews.Author: Bronwyn E. Horton "reader of all genres, vega...
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for my husband as he had been very patiently requesting a larger one for a couple years, but I couldn't justify a thousand bucks or more. When I saw this deal, I sprang for it, especially with prime shipping which came THE NEXT DAY! (to be fair, the shipping warehouse is in So Cal as well.) We had an LG dishwasher and washer/dryer installed last year and I have been very happy with both, of course TVs are a different 'animal' but it still bode well. It arrived and the deliveryman was so wonderful, he saw my husband is disabled so he brought it in, unboxed it, moved the old one for us, and put up the new one (on a shelf, not mounted to the wall, there are limits!) Obviously this is not due to Amazon, but it still made for a stellar experience.I'm sure there are tvs with more bells and whistles, but for the price, my husband was thrilled with his anniversary gift and I have to admit, I do like playing video games on the new, prettier, bigger screen too. ;)

Reviews.Title: Great TV and a Super Price!!
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Walbert
Reviews.Content: Great TV with a great price! Picture perfect and easy to install and set up. Needed to purchase an HDMI cable; otherwise, wonderful product.

Reviews.Title: Good value - but returned due to picture problems
Reviews.Author: graddy
Reviews.Content: Great deal on a good TV for the money. The picture was good, easy menus, and all in all you get a solid TV for low cost. The only problem was that there were weird flashes of red, white, green streaks that would shoot across the screen, always from the right side, on an intermittent basis (like every few minutes). LG said the TV was defective but that they hadn't heard of this being common. Obviously a deal breaker. Probably just a bad individual TV, as I hadn't read about this flaw from other reviews, but had to return it nonetheless and can't give it the 4 stars it deserves (but also don't believe in giving 1 star for what is an unpredictable flaw - presuming you get a working version of this TV for about five hundred bucks, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Plays Media Files From USB Drive w/o Problems
Reviews.Author: sandpiper
Reviews.Content: I hooked up a 1TB WD USB drive and this TV picked up my media files without any problems. Just plug 'n play. Very happy with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: James P. Hanson
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV (LG 32LK450).  This is a 32" , 1080p  TV.  Picture and sound quality are very good.  It was easy to set up.  Features are good, but didn't have to adjust anything after the initial setup.  It is a very good TV for the price, less than $400.00.  It is not clear how much difference the 1080p makes versus 720p for this picure size, probably not much.  I got this one rather than the 720p version since it didn't cost much more. I am fairly sure the 720p version would be just as good.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: James Anza "J Anza"
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV and the price is outstanding picture is as good as our 55" Samsung edge lit LED

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Jess
Reviews.Content: I love his TV...once I realized the energy save feature was on and turned it off the picture was perfect!

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!
Reviews.Author: elizabeth
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before I bought a TV and I figured that since I could get this with Amazon's no interest financing and since the reviews were overall pretty nice, I gave it a shot. I'm very skeptical about things like this, especially with such a reasonable price, but I'm very impressed. In fact, I think some of the reviews for this TV might actually hinder someone's decision to buy it. First of all, this TV is for my room. It's not for my living room or my home theater or what have you. It's for my bedroom. The size is great and the sound, unlike other reviews, is just fine. In fact, after reading the reviews on the questionable sound quality, I went out and bought a cheap soundbar from Target just as a precautionary thing. I hooked up the soundbar and it sounded good but then when I took it away I didn't notice that much of a difference with the sound, so I boxed the soundbar back up and I'm just using the TV as is. Another thing that concerned me a little about buying this TV was the "brown bezel" that has been bothering some people. It's on the very bottom of the bezel, it's about an inch high, and it's not a huge deal. If you can't concentrate on the TV because you're looking at this brown faux-wood looking bezel thing, then that's your issue. Another great thing about this TV is the picture. I'm sure for more money the picture could be a TAD better, but what impressed me is that I didn't have to upgrade my FiOS box. So maybe this TV has an HD adapter built in, I don't know, but the picture looks good with the regular cable box, as opposed to my brother who has a magnavox flat screen and had to go to verizon to get an HD box (which is an extra 10 bucks a month). The interface is awesome, very easy to switch between TV and DVD and iPad and whatnot. Overall I'm very, very happy with this purchase and I will absolutely buy from Amazon and LG again.

Reviews.Title: LG 37"
Reviews.Author: alivi
Reviews.Content: I've had this for about a month and really like it.  The only thing I notice is that when it is dark out and there is no or little light in the room, the screen seems very dark and not as bright as during the daytime.  Or maybe its just my aging eyes?

Reviews.Title: Better than the "upgraded" model
Reviews.Author: chompmyclit
Reviews.Content: This TV has a better picture with less jutter and more inputs than the newer model has. Only downside was the 24-hour mode clock, but there is a firmware update on LG's website that fixes the 24 hr clock issue. You need a USB thumb drive to update. The USB drive is nice to watch video downloaded from the internet.After owning this television for a year now, my only problem is sound. I do not have the bass maxed out and never blast the volume, but I hear a vibration coming from the set even at volumes so low that I can barely hear people speaking on the TV. Other people have remedied this by purchasing a special screw kit for the speakers. Others have had problem with a piece of plastic that clips in where the wall mount would attach. Kind of a bummer.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: MissDestructingMyPhoneIsAThingOfThePast
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a 19" tube tv and this has been fabulous. Slight difficulty watching dark movies but that could also be an issue with my DVD player. Very worth the money

Reviews.Title: Did not function properly after 1 1/2 weeks of use.
Reviews.Author: Christinalina
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing when, after 1 1/2 weeks of use, the television started turning itself off and on while we were watching. It would not respond to the remote. It would not recognize a connected device. The only way to turn it off was to physically unplug it from the outlet. This was a used television from Warehouse Deals, not a new television. Picture quality was very good. Physical appearance was very good - too bad it did not work!

Reviews.Title: Nice TV for the price!!
Reviews.Author: Sergio. "Sergio."
Reviews.Content: This review is from: LG 42LK450 42-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LCD HDTV (Electronics)42LK450-SA (do not think it is an IPS panel)I've recived this TV last saturday.Mainly used with PC, and cable box.1) The plastics looked some filmsy to me.2) The screen delivers very very very crisp and good colors for HD content. (HD cable box, PC, WD TV LIVE)3) Sepeakers sounds week, but enough.4) Optical out is great to linsten media from USB drive on the external receiver.5) Professional image settings options !!!!!I've faced 2 issues.1)when connecting the PC.(HDMI)The screen has black borders and the text from PC was blurred, this is because the pixel mapping is not 1:1 (even if the res is 1080p) then I used "just scan" setting, but did not work to me initiallyBut now, magically, 2 minutes after the windows desktop is displayed when the PC starts, the image increase automatically to fit in the whole screen......I do not understand why i have to wait 2 minutes to have the screen automatically streched.After that the pixel mapping is 1:1 and everything is cristal clear.1) Connected to an HD calbe box PACE DC550D (HDMI)Initially worked fine, but once you turn the TV off and then on, there is no sound from the TV.To make it work again I have to reset the Cable box, or change the imput to another one and then come back to the correct one. It seems in this way the connection to the cable box is reseted.The Cable box works fine with my old 37' LG.I guees it is a TV software failure or a kind of noncompatibility.Used with the WD TV LIVE this does not happnes.Note: out of the box the image is not so good and too bluish !! Initially I thought O my...what a piece of c...But after a minimun image tune I can say the image quality is really very very good.Here it costs, 1000 american dollars ( yes and it is the cheapest 42' I could find)After rebates and discounting taxes I have it for 600 american dollars, for this money you can buy the most cheaper 32' here)Some drawbacks but still a good TV with a very good image.-----------------

Reviews.Title: LOVE
Reviews.Author: Carrie456
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this TV!!!! it has a wonderful picture, that is sharp and clear. It is also very easy to navigate inputs which is good because I switch between the TV, my xbox, and my old playstation 2 all the time! I have had this TV for about a year now and it is still going strong! I haven't had a single problem with it and am so happy I went with this TV. I did a LOT of searching online and in multiple stores and this seemed like the best deal at the time and I haven't had a single regret!!!the ONLY thing I have to say negative about it is that it has an auto energy saving mode, and when the light in the room changes the screen noticeably dims or brightens. It can be a little annoying at times, and I don't know that there is a way to turn this setting off. But that really isn't a huge deal and is literally my only negative thing about this TV.

Reviews.Title: A great value
Reviews.Author: Steve Guy
Reviews.Content: We have had the TV for a couple of months now and are very very pleased.  The feature that I value most other than the obvious (picture & sound) is the light sensor.  We use this TV in our bedroom so it is frequently on when the lights are off.  The fact that it dims itself accordingly so that there isn't a bright light in our dark room is fantastic.  Then when you turn the lights on, wait a few seconds and get brightens accordingly.  Menus/remote are very easy to navigate.We are very satisfied with this unit.

Reviews.Title: Not up to LG's usual standards...
Reviews.Author: JP
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to replace a LG 37" 720p television.  I had that one for over 6 years, and was very happy with it.  I wanted to upgrade to a 1080p TV, and needed a 37".  I also wanted 3 HDMI inputs, something that is very hard to find in that size and combination.  With my previous experience, I decided to go with LG.  The TV had everything I wanted, but there was a problem with the sound.  After selecting an input to turn on, say, the cable or my Playstation 3, once it had started up a minute in to whichever device you were using the sound would go out for about 3 seconds.  I tried numerous devices, cables, etc. but it still happened.I called LG, and they were going to contact the service agent in my area.  He said I needed to have the main board replaced.  Once it came in, he replaced the board and the TV wouldn't even show a picture.  The gentleman said it must be a bad board, and that he would order another.  A couple of weeks later, the 2nd board showed up and was installed.  The problem did not go away, and a 3rd board was on order.  At this point it had been 2 months and no resolution was in sight.  LG told me that if the next board didn't fix it, that I could put in a request for a review of the item for a refund.  LG, however, has to approve a refund and could offer a replacement but it wouldn't necessarily be the same model.  Since this was the only model I could find through LG with the specifics of 1080p, 37" and 3 HDMI ports I knew they would not be able to replace it since this was not the 2012 model.I wanted to exchange it through Amazon at the beginning but they had been sold out.  Also, the returns department could refund me based on how old the television was.  So even though I had it 2 months and it hadn't functioned properly since day 1 I could receive less than I paid based on the fact I had owned it for 2 months.  I returned it to Amazon and purchased a Panasonic instead.  After all this, I would be very hesitant to pick up ANY LG product in the future after the way they treated this customer.

Reviews.Title: Excellent, but.....
Reviews.Author: Constant reader
Reviews.Content: I agree that this is a first-rate set at a very reasonable price, but I also agree that the manual is hopelessly inadequate. There is virtually no explanation of the options that are available through the "Home" and "Menu" buttons, and it took a call to LG to get my set working properly. The person there was helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: Diggin it so far
Reviews.Author: Confused
Reviews.Content: April 2012 Had the tv for a total of two days and I like it so far. Had an old, outdated, heavy, color-faded set before. This one is good! To start, it's so light. I am a 25 year old woman and I was able to carry it inside from where the fedex guy left it by myself. Set up was quick. I did need to find a rather long and slender screw driver to get the tiny screws into the base. I love that it has 3 HDMI ports and two RCA inputs. Picture is alright- not quite as good as my ex's isymphony, but still lovely. It did not come with an HDMI cable. I was able to program my directv remote to work all of the controls on the television, satellite and dvd. Love the touch controls on the face of the television.I'll add to this as time goes to see how well the tv holds up to the rigors of a family who loves their entertainment.__________________________________________________________________________________________________UPDATEHad it for a little more than a month. Still liking it. Got it hooked up to the ps3, bluray is knock-your-socks off pretty. Sound's still leaving a bit to be desired. Gonna look into getting a speaker bar. It is a dust and finger print magnet, so keep your little cleaning cloth that comes with it nearby. I noticed that it does have a little sticky plastic wood grain thingy on the front of the tv that I hadn't noticed before. It's starting to peel off, which is why I noticed it. I think the tv would look nicer without it, but I'm worried about pulling it off because I don't know if what's behind it is worse looking (why else would they put it there?). No trouble with image burn and have had LOTS of widescreen black bar action going on.__________________________________________________________________________________________________Jan 2013UPDATE 2- Almost a year since I bought it, still working perfectly! No dead pixels, no issues with speakers or sound. This tv gets a lot of use. It's on probably 15 hours every day. Love it! Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: New experience
Reviews.Author: CalifWoman "jewelry fan"
Reviews.Content: My old TV was 15 yrs old and quite different from this one. I am still adjusting the settings to find what I like.It is a very nice looking TV and a good size for my living room. I have it on a stand that moves around so I can watch it from anywhere in the room. The only thing I am not too pleased with is the stand. It is just made of molded plastic. With the admonition not to over tighten the screws joining the stand with the back of the TV, I have tightened them as much as I dare but the TV is still sort of wobbly. I would like something a lot more rigid especially since I live in California and worry about earthquakes ( I can just picture the TV stand snapping off and crashing to the floor).Delivery of the item was very quick, the packaging very good-it was easy to unpack-and I was able to assemble it and set it up myself ( I am a 73 yr old woman).All-in-all it is a nice TV and I gave it only 4stars because of the wobbly stand connection.

Reviews.Title: Nice HDTV
Reviews.Author: Vermont Ken "Vermont Intruder1400"
Reviews.Content: My first Flatscreen HD TV, but did a lot of comparisons before pulling the trigger on the 37" model. Not to big, not to small. Did not want the "TV" to be the defining object in my living room, but wanted the "gee wiz" factor a large screen TV. The 37 is perfect for this.After some adjusting, the picture is wonderful, sharp and clear, with very good skin tones. That's the "bar" for a digital TV, how well it projects accurate looking skin tones.  Turned off most of the dynamic settings of the very extensive adjustment menus offered. A nice feature, but can be a maze to work through. Once set, a great picture. Sound is good for a flat screen, better than many others, but if your turn on the simulated surround sound (which is pretty nice) you cannot have "Clearvoice", which is also a nice audio feature. If you listen to music on this TV you will want to invest in a sound system. There is only a digital audio out, but it does have an analog earphone jack, which I am using with my old computer sound system. Not the best, but I already had it sitting around.All in all, if this TV doesn't go south anytime in the next few years, it will be a great HDTV for less than $450.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV
Reviews.Author: john m
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased an Insignia 37 inch lcd from BESTBUY for a super price of $299.I returned it because i could not adjust it to my liking.Either the picture was to bright or the dark scenes to dark.I returned it and picked up this set because of all the stellar reviews.At first i was very disappointed with this set also.The settings out of the box had everything very muted and washed out.For $100 more i thought i made a BIG mistake but after tweaking ALL the settings i found the sweet spot.Now i am very content with the choice i made.This set has an AWESOME PICTURE as long as you realize you will have to make adjustments.Don't forget to protect your investment with a SQUARETRADE WARRANTY.

Reviews.Title: lg 37 inch LK450
Reviews.Author: laudip
Reviews.Content: this is a great tv. the picture quality is amazing and even though the sound breaks sometimes, it has a tremendous sound quality. i have connected this tv to my ps3 and its working to perfection. the buttons on the tv are touchscreen. it is just amazing what you will discover this tv can do.

Reviews.Title: Great do-it-all 1080p TV that is sized just right
Reviews.Author: Roy Basilisk
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV since this past Christmas and figure that by now it has proven itself a great buy.  The TV I was picking up was to be an all-purpose replacement for a trusty old Samsung 23" 720p bedroom tv (the living room tv is a 50-incher): for 1080p via dedicated blu-ray player; for Xbox 360; an hdmi cable box; part-time use as a 1920x1080 PC monitor via vga for a secondary pc; plus extra connections to possibly run an older PS2 via component or other consoles as I see fit.  It handles all of these functions with great aplomb, something which cannot be taken for granted.  For instance, when researching the owner's manuals for competing televisions there were often caveats such as not offering full 1920x1080 via vga.  And this 37" size seems perfect.  Expansive and immersive up close yet holds up quite well from a distance, and fitting just right in a crowded entertainment center.Image quality is indeed excellent, with the issue regarding relatively light black levels easily addressed through the extensive tweaking options.  Screen brightness is also readily modified via the green "Energy" button (Off/min/med/max/auto).  This is something I always used on my old Samsung (3 settings) as well.  Full brightness on when playing blu-ray or 360, but when watching CNN or what-not there's no reason to waste the screen blaring brightly.  I personally don't let the "Auto" setting choose for me.  For gaming, there is not truly a dedicated "Game Mode" like on my old Samsung (the "game mode" here is basically just some brightness presets), but that is moot given there is no input lag to be found.  And I am one who plays various types of games requiring responsive input such 2D shooters like Raiden IV, racing games such as Forza 3, intense action game Vanquish, and the usual fps titles.The wealth of settings also extends to picture configuration, such as depending on source the usual 16:9/Just Scan/Zoom options but also a handy Cinema Zoom allowing quite a bit of flexibility.  To wit, my settings have resulted in "Cinema Zoom 15" when bringing to full-screen/proper aspect a channel that shows only a small center-boxed 16:9 image under natural circumstances.  Also, there is a dedicated function to properly center the vga pc image.  If you initially encounter an off-center pc image simply call up the "Screen (RGB-PC)" option.Last but not necessarily least is the surprisingly loud and capable built-in audio, a major weak spot on my older Samsung.  While I have an external stereo system that I never forget to pump things through when playing videogames or movies, I am also content shutting everything else off and using the onboard speakers when watching normal television.  One could get along quite well just going with the built-in speakers in general.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for one, not so good for sharing
Reviews.Author: benthere
Reviews.Content: After solving several odd problems, my 32LK450 got a fabulous picture BUT ... the extremely narrow viewing angle and a problematic tuner compelled me to send it back. My LK450 absolutely refused to give acceptable TV performance until I replaced my RG59 coax with RG6. RG59 is supposed to be acceptable for cable TV but my LK450 didn't work too well with it.  (My 42" Vizio worked fine on the same RG59 even further downstream.) When I played a DVD, I could see the picture quality the LK450 is capable of. The one feature of LG I really liked, after I got used to it, is the way the remote works. It is odd at first but after a short time I really liked it. Amazon scheduled a UPS pickup and refunded my money with no hassle at all. I purchased a 26" LV2500 which actually is a better size for my office. It has a brighter picture but just does not have that eye-catching pop the LK450 had. The LK450's sound, though not spectacular, was acceptable. The viewing angle and the TV tuner are my only two complaints about the LK450. The picture, as long as I was directly in front of it, is the best I've seen.  Yes, even over $ony and $amsung.

Reviews.Title: LG 37" LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Bruce Berndt
Reviews.Content: I purchased a 47" LCD 3D TV for our family room and loved it. When my wife lobbied for an HD TV for the bedroom I looked first at the largest size that I could put in the space available and found the perfect size from LG.  It's picture is great, the sound is excellent and the installation was very easy. We both love it for our late evening viewing.

Reviews.Title: 32LK450 Has Met All Expectations
Reviews.Author: DWarbucks
Reviews.Content: Before selecting this LCD TV, I read numerous reviews of all ratings. This 32 inch TV is located in our bedroom where my wife and I(retired) like to watch college hockey.  Our viewing distance is rather close at 6-8 feet and it works out fine.  Our cable service doe not yet deliver high def but the viewing is still fine for our purposes.  Menu selections are easy and automatic settings can be easily over ridden to suit your own preferences.  It might be that the automatic corrections for ambient lighting occurs faster than the human eye can adapt so that the display momentarily seems too dark or too light.  In any case, this is not a problem because options are available to override the effect.  I'm very pleased with this purchase.  The price was in the low 300's, it came on time, undamaged in shipment, easy to set up and pleasant to watch.  Oh yes, the sound seemed less than adequate out of the box but I looked up a few audio adjustments and greatly improved it.LG 32LK450 32-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LCD VA Panel HDTV

Reviews.Title: Great tv!
Reviews.Author: maf
Reviews.Content: The tv arrived without any issues (was a little nervous about ordering a tv to be shipped), easy to set up, and most importantly has beautiful picture!

Reviews.Title: LG 42LK450 42-Inch LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Jerry Mason
Reviews.Content: Purchased from Amazon on 26 Dec 2011 and it arrived via Fedex on 29 Dec. No damage in shipment. Took 30 to 45 minutes to remove from packaging and set it up. Picture and sound quality are comparable to my 52" Sony Bravia KDL-52W3000 which is to say it is excellent. If you are considering the purchase of an entry level set this unit should be on your short list. If by chance you purchase a set that is damaged, incomplete or otherwise unserviceable,I would highly recommend an exchange as the failure rate on this set appears to be quite minimal.

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: Marine Cajun
Reviews.Content: Bought another brand of TV and was not happy with the picture.  Returned to warehouse store where purchased and ordered this LG TV. Like night and day!  This has a great picture.  Service was great, received within a week and love the set.

Reviews.Title: If at first you don't succeed........
Reviews.Author: Pedro Triana "Pete"
Reviews.Content: Ok, I bought this TV for my dad for Christmas, it came and he loved it but it had a cluster of dead pixels in the center of the screen. I was heart broken and had to return it, now why would I rate it 5 stars after that. Well Amazon sent me a new one right away at the same price as I purchased the first one, even though it had gone up in price. The new one came in a matter of days and it was perfect. I have a top of the line UN55D8000 Samsung and am an audio and videophile and still I was very impressed with this little TV. Great image blur reduction, great color accuracy, plenty of inputs and sleek design.Very happy and thank you amazon

Reviews.Title: Great for everything
Reviews.Author: Locosnowman
Reviews.Content: I use this monitor on a High end Gaming PC and the image is incredible, you will have to play with some settings for the picutre, but once dialed in, you will love this

Reviews.Title: Great Value and awesome quality!
Reviews.Author: andy07
Reviews.Content: This is the first flat screen LCD TV I have ever purchased (yes I was still surviving on the classic 90's box TV's!), and I must say, this has been a fantastic purchase. I ordered it for $475, and the identical set was at $520 at Best buy (taxes etc included). I chose free super saving shipping, and the delivery estimate was set between 5th and 10th January (I ordered on 26th December). I was pleasantly surprised when I learnt that the set was delivered to me literally THREE days later on the 29th! Early new years present!Regarding set up, this TV is incredibly easy to set up. I actually managed it all entirely on my own, from unpacking to lifting to mounting the set on the stand. The setup itself was incredibly easy as the auto tune options self generated when I first switched it on. Within a few minutes, I was up and running. I read some of the other reviews about the sound quality and sharpness etc - I found for now that my sharpness has been set to 80, and I am set to Sports picture mode. I suspect I will have to continue playing around with the various display features this TV offers, but all in all, this was an incredibly simple process. I would highly recommend this TV for the price range - nothing like a sleek LG LCD TV!

Reviews.Title: LG makes the best
Reviews.Author: Katherine
Reviews.Content: I have never been disappointed with an LG product. TV has beautiful display, plenty of ports for all our equipment. It recalls which ports you use most when switching between them (blue-ray player, cable, wii, etc.).The 32LK450 is an excellent value for the quality you get.Only complaint is that it has a weak digital tuner. My older digital TV could get better reception for the local news channels using the same indoor antennae. I had to buy an outdoor antennae to get it to work.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: This tv is a great buy I spent a lot of time researching tvs and I'm glad I purchased this one.. Good quality, reliable brand.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: C. Cochran
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv for our bedroom.  It has a great picture and was very easy to set up.  Great tv for the price!

Reviews.Title: Better than I hoped for!
Reviews.Author: Finsta
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for my 6 year olds room with the idea I may watch it on occasion. I bought this after reading all the great reviews but never saw it in person. Set up was extremely intuitive and I didn't even open the manual. After the brief calibration process, the streamed netflix picture beats my 55" high def signal hands down. Colors, contrast, resolution etc.  are stunning......almost looks 3 dimensional! Now I want to watch this tv all the time. Unbelieveable bang for the buck. I will be buying another.

Reviews.Title: LG42LK450 LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Nelia
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality, sound is very good. Very easy to assemble.great for my PS3 nice picture. The price is right.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for Great Price
Reviews.Author: Aaron Hendrix
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV around black Friday, because I am in an apartment and not dorm setting anymore. I needed a larger screen that looked good and wouldn't break my bank.This TV cost me $300 and the shipping was free. It was packaged nicely and came with all of the components. Assembly was quick and easy. It worked without any necessary set up right out of the box. This set also doubles as a giant monitor for my desktop PC. If you're really into your TV's imaging, this is a good set to go that won't leave you feeling poor or ripped-off. I've bought a Westinghouse (geat deal but never again) and two Samsungs (great sets for good money). I'd have to say that my Westinghouse is about a 4/10 and the Samsungs are both 9/10. This would be a 9/10 with consideration of picture quality, built in sound, features and price. If you demand that most out of your set, this is definitely a good buy. If I had to choose between an LG and a Samsung for a future purchase, I would have to put them side-by-side and probably let price dictate the purchase.The calibration menus are pretty detailed. They allow for two user-defined settings which is perfect for my console gaming and PC gaming.Pros: Beautiful image, great built-in speakers, nice color, user friendlyCons: Contrast is up nearly all the way, so I feel that I will need to recalibrate in a few years.Neutral: Brown gradient strip at the bottom that supposed to add....style? Flair? Whatever it is, its ugly.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price.
Reviews.Author: lolmont
Reviews.Content: LG 32LK450 32-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LCD VA Panel HDTV I ordered this tv for $300 and I must say I'm impressed, I've owned 3 hdtvs a sony wega crt 34inch which broke a Samsung 46inch 120hz tv which of course I still own and now this for a room. I'd call this a fantastic small place/room tv and it's great for video games low input lag I haven't noticed any ghosting, colors are good and tons of inputs I have a old 360 with no hdmi so I was glad to see a tv with two component hook ups so I can hook up my Wii/360 without having to unplug the other. I can't comment on the speakers really tested them for a second they seem to have the tin can sound you get from a lot of lcd tv's but I hooked up external speakers right away. Also the menus are very easy to navigate id almost say even easier then Samsung's. First time ordering a tv online Amazon was great came quick box wasn't damaged and no problems with the TV will order a TV again if I need to off amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great TV even though I returned mine
Reviews.Author: Citizen John
Reviews.Content: Everything seemed great. Considering everything, the price is fair. At about 40 lbs, this TV can be mounted anywhere. It has 3 HDMI ports and 1 USB port. The brown colored strip along the bottom didn't deter me.The box was missing the remote, hardware and manual. It looked to me like it had been taped shut a couple times before. With a fouled order, I returned it. I just got an LG DVD player, the one intended to be used with this TV. I still like LG products in general.This is just my experience and it was probably a matter of bad luck.

Reviews.Title: AMAZON COMES THRU AGAIN!
Reviews.Author: Robert P. Harrison "tennis  freak"
Reviews.Content: First TV had a ghost image the size of a head.So Amazon to the rescue!Returned defective set one day and received replacement set next day.Replacement TV has great picture,easy adjustment settings,and great sound clarity.My hearing has faded over the years so sound clarity was a significant factor in selecting a LG product.I especially liked the swivel base and earphone hookup features.Price from Amazon was as usual unbeatable.TV was setup in 10 minutes.I researched different brands for over 3 months and found this set on sale for $399 after Black Friday.Picture quality as good or better than any of the top 4 brands."Consumer Reports"rates this model as excellent and repair history for LG is less than 4 percent.Buy it and keep on trucking AMAZON!

Reviews.Title: Great 32" HD television...impressed with LG so far...
Reviews.Author: Bk Justice
Reviews.Content: My wife and I began looking for a new television when our Sony KDL32L5000 32" HD television developed lines and ghost images on the screen.  Since the television was less than two years old and we had invested in the Sony brand, we were more than a little discomforted.Having to go through this process once again and invest in a television for our home, I decided to research and review customer ratings on Amazon.com.  I appreciate Amazon, its resources, its' commitment to offering competitive prices, as well as all the customer reviews.I thoroughly examined a number of customer reviews which I appreciated and they helped me decide on a LG 32LK450 32" HD television.  We have dual sources for programming, so having a quality tuner was necessary since our location is a rural area and most OTA (free) television reception is degraded.  We also were interested in the viewing angle and certainly the picture and audio quality.We've only had it a short time so I can only report my satisfaction to this point.  HD picture is GREAT!  Non-hd good and understandably reduced quality.  The viewing angle and audio is more than satisfactory.  The TV tuner appears to receive as many channels as our Sony did, however without the degree of fragmenting and pixilation associated with weak signals (even during recent inclement weather).  This suggest it's a better tuner, which were enjoying.Having taken so much time researching, unfortunately I missed out on Amazons' Black Friday specials, missing a great buy.  However to Amazons' credit, their low price guarantee allowed me to get a very good price a week later($324).Also I would like to add that we decided to purchase a Square Trade 4-year warranty($54), hopefully to protect against a television departing before its time.So currently we LOVE it...to be continued...

Reviews.Title: Highly Recommended
Reviews.Author: Thursday Trader
Reviews.Content: Purchased the LG 32LK450 television from Amazon and it arrived quickly and in perfect condition. Setup was easy.The 1080p 60 Hz picture quality is bright, blur-free, and wonderful -- especially while watching content that is in HD.The sound quality is excellent and loud, and even better if you select "Infinite Sound" (Surround Sound) under AUDIO OPTIONS.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture quality
Reviews.Author: MILIND KALKAR
Reviews.Content: It was easy to assemble, have a great picture quality , price was also good. Kids loved to play and watch on this new TV.

Reviews.Title: Great buy for the price!
Reviews.Author: Austin
Reviews.Content: I just got my LG 37" HDTV and I've been fully satisfied. It is my first HDTV purchase so I don't have another TV to compare to but this TV is great! Only cons I have for this TV is the 60hz refresh rate. If you play video games it takes a split second to focus 100% but its not that bad.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Little TV!
Reviews.Author: Plati
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to get this at a really nice deal on Black Friday... but to be honest, after using it I would definitely pay the extra money for this.The fact that this is a 1080p 32" TV is what really got me to take a shot on it, the LG brand didn't hurt either.  Just let me tell you the picture quality is amazing, I saw a few other review sites that said this TV had some issues with it's blacks being too light... I have not noticed this issue at all, in fact the blacks look better than they do on my 50" TV.I would highly recommend this TV for an office/bedroom/gaming room.  I primarily use this for gaming and it's amazing to that end.The only con I would list would be that the energy saver feature can be a little annoying, but that's pretty easily corrected by turning it off all together.

Reviews.Title: LG 32LK450
Reviews.Author: Charles H. Mayhaus
Reviews.Content: This TV is excellant.The picture and sound are excellant.I would reccomend to any of my friends.I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great Set
Reviews.Author: Troy
Reviews.Content: Have had this TV for about a month now and am very happy with it.  The picture quality is great, although the edges around some things when watching non-HD seem a little rough at times (although that could well be the cable company as well).  It produces a bright picture with a very nice black (unlike some other sets).  The sound is good for standard TV speakers.  My only complaint is with the remote which isn't laid out how I would do it but is still very usable.  All and all, a very nice TV for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great price!
Reviews.Author: Scott Turner "EngineerBoy"
Reviews.Content: We got the 32" version of this TV for our home office.  It looks and sounds great, and so far we love it, so much so that we bought a second one for our bedroom.  We mounted the bedroom one on the wall using this wall mount:  AVF RESL422B-F Orbital Tilt and Turn TV Mount with AV Shelving for 25 to 40-Inch Flat Panel TV Screens (Black).  We love both of them!

Reviews.Title: LG 37LK450 37-Inch 1080p 60Hz LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Manny Santiago
Reviews.Content: TV has a great picture but i've run into some issues with external devices connected through the HDMI ports where it will lose connection for a millisecond. this is displayed by a quick flash and a popping sound. it is remedied if you power cycle the tv.

Reviews.Title: Boy, am I happy with this one!
Reviews.Author: malcolmstewart
Reviews.Content: After a terrible experience on Ebay trying to get a refurb. LG tv I came to my senses and got a brand new one from Amazon. Great delivery and great customer service which for me is par for the course at Amazon. The tv itself is amazing. I think the picture compares nicely to my Panasonic plasma. Great blacks and no color bleeding. I couldn't ask for more for the price. The main reason I bought LG is because I have an LG monitor for my home computer and I love it. Just hope now that it lasts.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV, LG and perfect for my needs.
Reviews.Author: James Mac
Reviews.Content: Because I love my 42" LG I have in my bedroom I bought this TV for my guest bedroom. Though this TV is not a smart TV nor is it internet friendly like the one in my bedroom, I love this TV just the same. I have an older Computer and the X-box set up in the room so that Nephews/ nieces or guest can watch Netflix or play games. I've only had it for a week but it's perfect for my needs.Excellent picture quality, and every aspect of the picture can be customized very easily in the advance mode to fit your personal needs. In fact picture quality can be setup for every individual input device.It has all the standards features of most of today's TVs (sleep timer, auto-on/off, etc). The sound is excellent for the size of the room I have it in (10 X 12) so I can't complain.Also up until I read a review I never notice the extremely very light brown trim at the very bottom of the TV (It's nowhere near the viewing area of the screen). I set this TV up on a wall mount so I can't say anything about the included mount.Overall I love this TV and will be using it often just to make it work to see if it fails before the warranty expires.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with the purchase!
Reviews.Author: raleigh
Reviews.Content: This TV has an amazing picture! HD channels look stunning, almost too clear and real. I use it also to watch Hulu Plus and other programs via Roku. It works great and the sound is better than I expected. Love the "Clear Voice" settings.

Reviews.Title: Best Deal from Amazon
Reviews.Author: TK  Travel "RebelOne"
Reviews.Content: When buying products check to make sure they are from the Amazon outlets...Fast Free Shipping.. Easy purchase .. High Quality LG Television.10 Minute install. Best Picture.. also works as a computer monitor.3-HDMI ports works with 720p or 1080i.Most Monitors/Tv cost hundreds more.LG 32LK450 32-Inch 1080p 60Hz LCD HDTVThe Best I have seen. Thank you

Reviews.Title: Great TV and great price
Reviews.Author: R. Ho
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for the dorm room and am very pleased with it. I have no complaints about this TV. Sound quality is great compared to other 32-inch TVs. Picture quality is awesome. There is nothing special about the remote -- it works just fine. One thing I like in particular is that when you select the input, a box pops up with pictures for each input -- one that is lit up means that there is a device detected. I also really like the included swivel stand. Overall awesome TV.

Reviews.Title: Just One Problem
Reviews.Author: Timothy Pauff
Reviews.Content: I do not like the "Energy Saving" mode. After runing the setup the picture had poor contrast even at max setting. The LG was in "Energy Saving Mode" less contrast = less power use "great if you live in a cave". All products today are built to be "Energy Saving" Whats next, race cars with "Energy Saving" buttons that govern their speed to 65 Mph? The mode is an option and has an on/off button on the remote.I am sold on LG products and I am bad about not reading the manual first. I am the reason some products have a yellow insert telling you something important that has already been covered in the manual. Still love LG ,,Button Bad Idea , just unplug the unit after each use and save about $5.00 a year.

Reviews.Title: New TV-Megapixel out-no help for only 1 out?
Reviews.Author: C. Shafer "cdcnihfos"
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture and worked well for the first week we had it...just ordered last few days of Sept. for a birthday gift last week. We think it started today-a megapixel in the middle of the screen, (a little to the right of center) went out, or was out already and we had not noticed yet. I called LG to see if I should return to Amazon.com or have it serviced by them. They don't service if only one dot on your screen...very disappointed in this very poor customer service policy.  I just bought it 29 days ago and just gave it as a gift to my husband last week...wonder if Samsung has the same policy?  We perhaps should have stuck with Samsung? Exchanging with Amazon tomorrow we are shipping it back.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely great product
Reviews.Author: J. Abel
Reviews.Content: Far exceeded my expectations. Sound and video quality are vastly superior to the 40" RCA I had before (which was $50 more than this!). The unit looks very nice and has very refined screen menus, definitely looks professional. Great buy.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Easy Setup, Fits OUR Needs. Better Sound With HDMI Cable
Reviews.Author: Ethan A. Winning "ewin64"
Reviews.Content: Two weeks later: You can improve the sound quality by 100% by using an HTMI cable, so make this 4.5 stars instead of 4.After 17 years, our 27" Sony crapped out. Just upped and died. A week earlier, my wife and I were discussing what we'd do if it ever did go, and we said we'd get someone to repair it. Hah! Nobody repairs anything with a tube anymore. So it was a good thing we started to look.The first consideration was size, and the place we have to watch this set can take a 32", but even a 37" would be too large. We headed over to BestBuy - the only game in this town - and looked at Sony, Samsung, LG, and Toshiba. A couple of years ago, we would have chosen the Toshiba, but we didn't care for the picture quality (even though we diddled a bit with the setting in the store). The Sony was $200 more, and for the amount of TV we normally want, that put it as an outside choice. Samsung was more money, but over all, we liked the picture on the LG best.We took it home, hooked it up (the hardest part was deciphering the instructions for installing the stand: the "manuals" are truly terrible) and that's when the fun started. Turns out you CAN'T watch hi-def on a HD set unless your cable box can get to the HD channels. I don't know about other "services," but Comcast charges an extra $30 a month. Well, it's baseball season, so what he heck. We now get about 20 HD channels.BUT, if for example, we're watching Channel 3, it says "Watch in HD," and you have to press "Enter" to get to Channel 703. That goes for most broadcast stations. It doesn't seem to apply to three of the PBS channels.Okay, so much for basics. The remote was great, but now we have to use the Comcast remote which was not designed for human use. The buttons are all wrong... but this is about the TV set. After fooling around with the various combos, we settled on "Expert 1" where I could set the contrast, brightness, etc. Vivid was the next choice, and most of the others didn't work out for us. Every once in a while, we hit a channel where, although it's HD, it doesn't fill the screen or the colors are "off." But we go back a looonnng way, and when we got our first color TV, we learned to live with purple people, so we can cope with the foibles of Comcast and channels.Why 4 stars? It IS energy efficient, but the cable box runs about 100 watts. It has a clear and bright picture, and it isn't LG's fault that we're not willing to pay $130 a month for all HD and the "premium" channels. But, the sound is variable. By that I mean that it can change from channel to channel, but look at this variation: for baseball, we turn it to 18-22. For broadcast news, sometimes as high as 25-28. But for PBS - which is rarely in HD if you watch "Mystery" and even some "Nova," I've had it up to 90!!! It's not muffled, but why so high? I have no idea.(We were deciding whether to get external speakers, but changing the "RCA" cables for one HDMI improved the sound by 100%. Now, normal range is 10-20.)As for the following: Intelligent Sensor, ISFccc Ready, and Picture Wizard, they seem useless. At least we haven't found a use for them. We do like being able to plug a digital camera into the front, though we probably won't do that more than once or twice. And I have my photos on a USB drive that plugs into the left side. You can access the pictures and your own music on that drive with the LG remote. However, there is good an bad in that. If your pictures started with a 3.2 mp camera, and now go to a 14 mp, many will not be in HD and many will show the poor quality of 3.2 mp from 2001-2005. So, we won't be watching slide shows any more than we did when we bored people to tears in 1970.I do recommend the LG. But check with your cable company or Dish or whatever to find out what you need. BY ALL MEANS, GO NO LOWER THAN 1080p! Anything less, and you might as well do without HD. Want to see the difference: At your local video store, try a 32" 720p and a 32" 1080p. Perhaps a 19" is okay at 720, but anything that remotely resembles HD has to be 1080.P.S. This set has been on sale for as low as $359 at BBY. The week after we bought it for $420, it dropped $20, and BBY was - as usual - great about giving us the $20 back. So, $400 is a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: OTA DTV User Is Pleased - Great Tuner
Reviews.Author: GoodCustomer
Reviews.Content: This is an initial evaluation after setup and a few hours use.Nothing remarkable about physical setup. I mounted it on my existing wall mount. The I/O stuff is mostly on the back on the left side (viewed from front), with secondary I/O on the left side. The main I/O panel on the back faces back, so no crawling to try to see labels on the bottom.The physical appearance is clean. It is as thin as I could wish, and the plain black border is pleasant.One thing that is outstanding about this model is something that not everyone cares about, but if you need it, you want a good one. That is the over the air tuner. It is excellent. I previously had been using a converter box as a tuner, because the Brand X (Sabre) TV I had had the world's worst tuner. I have a small outside antenna mounted on the exterior wall. The converter box received the "local" stations from about 30 miles away well enough. With the converter box, stations 50 miles away were shaky to the point being unreliable. This television not only has solid reception of all those, but it has slightly broken reception from an area about 85 miles away. I could no doubt get those solidly with an elevated antenna. The tuner is so good that you will have to spend a few moments cleaning out a bunch of poor signal stations from way off, after you scan in the channels. And you can stop the scan at any time, which was nice, because I didn't need to scan for cable channels.The picture was good out of the box, but I did some adjustments and found it even better. Nice blacks. Accurate skin tones. Over the air DTV is very crisp. Very good sound from the onboard speakers. All I want is good sound, and I can get it without accessory speakers or home theater systems. And enough adjustments to audio and video to shape both to suit individual taste. The Input menu is pictorial, which is nice. Other menus are also decent. Not everything is documented, but you can easily work it out.I'm very pleased and have nothing to complain of at all.

Reviews.Content: I've had this TV as a computer monitor for a couple weeks now and I'm very pleased with my purchase, but I will say up front that this model is not for everyone. If you want to use this guy as a computer monitor you couldn't do any better for the money. If you want to use this as a TV and watch at normal viewing distances (4+ feet), you'll NEVER notice the difference between this guy and a comparable 720p set. Definitely save the $50-80 and just buy a 720p tv.I bought it to replace a 3 year old Toshiba 32RV530U 1080p set, which I also used as a computer monitor. In doing some quick A-B comparisons the difference was clear. The LG holds blacks much better while displaying accurate colors at good amounts of brightness. Out of the box it performs well enough, but I would definitely urge you to turn down the Sharpness control significantly. In older sets Sharpness should be turned off completely, as Sharpness only artificially introduced information in the picture that is not native to the source. On this set I found that setting it to zero actually caused an artificially soft picture. Somewhere around 25 is the sweet spot.

Reviews.Title: Great sceen with a small "but." (What?)
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: I have been putting this review off forever, (Because of the tiny "but" mentioned in the title.)1. This is one FANTASTIC video monitor - flexible, easy to install, hook-up, adjust etc., and just plain beautiful to look at. (Recently bought a standard DVD of "Tale of Despereaux" [CG Animation] and it just sparkles! Live action adventure stuff is beyond belief. "...Center of the Earth." Etc.) Color, contrast, resolution...everything is top-notch in my opinion. I no longer send my money to the Gods of Cable and Satellite TV, so I can't speak to the standard digital signal quality, but I can't imagine it being anything less than amazing.2. I know there are more expensive monitors I could have purchased, with sophisticated high-end features to delight most blue-ray snobs, but I really don't need that, and honestly I can't afford to get into that stuff at the moment - and I'm totally satisfied without it. (I mean, how perfect can perfection get?) :-)Now for the small "but";3. My only regret about this purchase has to do with a small/medium "flaw" or smudge in the upper right portion of the screen. (Not a surface defect.) I read a few other reviews that mentioned a similar problem, and when I bought this unit "used" at an incredibly low price, I bit my lip and hoped that I would not get "bitten." Well, I did get bitten...and I've been watching this screen for months now, wondering if I was ever going to get the energy to complain and maybe send it back for a replacement.Believe it or not, I finally decided to accept the unit with the flaw, and train myself to react to it in a more positive way. The flaw looks like a faint, narrow, three-inch long fuzzy distortion of some kind that seems embedded in the structure of the matrix. It only shows up under certain conditions, (blue sky, certain flat-colors, fast camera-pans,) but most of the time I don't see it at all. As a typical perfectionist, and a Quality-Control Manager from years past, I squirm whenever I see the thing, but I'm usually the only one watching movies in my house these days, so I've learned not to squirm too severely.  My trick was to see the flaw as a Harry Potter type scar. He grew up seeing his own facial damage as a kind of badge of courage and magical experience, so I figure I can do the same with this. Believe it or not, it actually seems to work for me.Now, you're asking, WHY DIDN'T YOU SEND IT BACK???? (Idiot!)My reasons are several;FIRST, the unit arrived at least a week earlier than I could have hoped for, providing me with weeks of unexpected video amazement. (Actually shocked me when I saw the Delivery guy carrying it out of his truck.) (And no, he didn't hurl it into my yard like in those YouTube horror-clips.) YIKES!SECOND, while unpacking the wonderful beast, I came close enough to the screws that hold the back-panel on, to cause an unexpected spark. This happened twice, and nearly knocked me on my butt, so it may very well be that the unit arrived in perfect order, and my own haste and carelessness may have caused "the scar." Since I can't be sure of this, I allowed myself to "take the hit" on this one, and keep the unit "forever and ever"...Halleluiah.THIRD, the unit is just heavy enough to make me second-guess packing it up again and sending it away to be replaced. I'm getting just old enough these days to avoid anything that strains my poor body beyond a certain point.So, Why am I admitting to my acceptance of an obvious flaw? I'm doing it to make it clear, that even with the flaw, this screen has been giving me the best video viewing in my life. I occasionally watch video etc. from my computer (internet) through the HDMI Cable (Computer > Pioneer AV Amplifier > LG Monitor,) and even there, I am continually amazed at the clarity, contrast and saturation of the image.Obviously, I am thanking LG for creating such a wonderful monitor, and I'm recommending this unit to everyone.("Inexpensive" doesn't have to mean inferior.)

Reviews.Title: Glad I Bought this when I did!
Reviews.Author: Rolly D.
Reviews.Content: I am not sure how helpful this review will be since a newer version of this TV is out there, and this model is slowly being phased out of existence, but because I am so pleased with this TV I will write one anyway just in case. First some background: I was in the market looking for a reasonably priced (I am a college student on a limited budget), good quality TV that would be a good enough size to put in the family room of the house I will be moving into next year (currently I am living on campus, planning to move off). I spent weeks searching between all of the big box stores (Walmart, Costco, Bestbuy, etc...) trying to find something enough that would not break the bank. It seemed that the global, more mainstream brands like Sony and Samsung were too darn expensive, and I was destined to settle for a lesser known store brand. I was set to settle on a Vizio that had mediocre reviews when I stumbled upon this puppy on Amazon. To my surprise it was on sale for a fraction of the retail price. I knew that Amazon is a fickle mistress that changes with the tides, so I snatched this deal up immediately.Shipping and handling wise, I used my prime membership and it arrived in no time at all via UPS. Taking it out of the box, the TV had no cosmetic damage and it seemed to be packaged quite solidly (but I would advise against dropping this thing in box to test that theory). Turning on the TV and going through the initial set up, the TV was in perfect condition, with no dead pixels or software issuesPicture quality- I am not that big of a picture snob, so I consider this picture to be really damn good. I tested the HDMI picture by playing a 1080p video from the interwebs and playing some high resolution games on our X-box. Every time, the picture was very impressive sitting from my couch. As a note, I turned off the eco feature that dims the screen according to light. For some reason it was very noticeable to me regardless of ambient light in the room.Sound- I took the advice of others and tweaked the sound. Right out of the box the sound leaves something else to be desired, so do what I did and use the recommendations of other reviewers as a baseline and tweak to taste.Connections- Unlike the "newest" model, this TV comes stacked with 3 and not 2 HDMI ports. This is really handy because it allows us to keep our cable box and X-box constantly plugged in while leaving the 3rd port free (we usually stream stuff directly from our laptops through HDMI). This also boasts two older-tech AV ports, handy for plugging in older devices such as our Wii and Nintendo 64 which. There are also many other ports which are listed in the description. Needless to say this is stacked with plenty of connections/ports which makes life a lot easier, and me a lot happier.Luckily it seems that as always the other reviewers on Amazon did not lead me astray. I was able to snatch up this sweet deal of a TV without having to compromise quality. I have had this TV for a couple of months now, and I am absolutely pleased with my purchase. In summary this is a good quality, good looking TV that provides a lot of flexibility for whoever buys it. If you have the opportunity to get this model on the cheap, I highly suggest you do what I did and buy it while you still can!

Reviews.Title: A Great TV, Affordable Price!  No Complaints!
Reviews.Author: ZbadhabitZ
Reviews.Content: Like many other reviewers, I came to Amazon in search of an affordable, 1080p, 32-inch TV.  After some extensive research, I settled upon this product, and decided to give it a go.  To make note, I use this product solely with my third-generation Apple TV, which provides 1080p content.  I have not tried it with cable, Blu-Ray, DVD, etc.After ordering this product, the box arrived at my home just three days later (I paid for no "expedited" shipping).  In awe of the prompt delivery time, I opened up the package, and found the television very simple to set up.  If you are using the table-top stand, some basic assembly was required, but the instructions were very clear and easy to understand.  The television provides an incredible number of inputs, which I cannot comment on as I am only using one HDMI input.  Additionally, the remote is very intuitive, easy-to-understand, and functioned as expected.In terms of actual performance, the television is really quite great.  The sound quality is exceptional (I typically leave it at around 12 or 13 volume, which works well from hearing across the room).  Like previous reviewers have noted, adjusting some of the brightness and contrast settings can really help to adjust the perfect viewing environment for your home.  I spent about twenty minutes playing with the settings, including using some settings another reviewer posted, but ended up finding some of the preset settings worked best.  I tested a few 1080p items (a movie, a downloaded TV show, and Netflix streaming), all of which really looked great.  I found that when standing very close to the television, the picture quality appears rather standard, but when sitting about 8 or 10 feet back (which is, realistically, how people watch TV), it is that crisp 1080p quality you'd expect.I really have no negative things to say about this television.  For the price, I think it is an exceptional value, and would happily buy again.  If you're willing to spend more, yes, there are other products out there that provide a more lively picture, but in this price range, this absolutely is the best television I've come across.  I'd strongly recommend to buy.
