Reviews.Title: LG 32" LK450 - great buy!!
Reviews.Author: J. Turner "JT"
Reviews.Content: I read other reviews about the LG 32LK450 TV before purchasing ... most were glowing reviews. I am very pleased with my purchase of this TV through Amazon. The TV was shipped almost immediately and ariived safely. Set-up was easy and the picture and sound is excellent!!!! I would recommend this item as well as purchasing via Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: mbriones87
Reviews.Content: I realized purchasing this product that it was an older model now that most TV's seem to be moving toward LED, but I was pleasantly surprised at this TV's quality for the price. No complaints here. Like LG and look forward to purchasing any future TV's from Amazon. Great experience all around.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Savannah Sal
Reviews.Content: Great television - seems bigger than a 32 inch.  Easy to set up. I highly recommend this TV, and I think it was fairly priced.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with TV
Reviews.Author: Kenneth E. Amaro
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my grandparents who had an old 32" tube tv for Easter. I ordered it kind of close but got the product right on time. I set it up for them, it was real easy & easy for them to figure out too. Image quality is great. Most of the reviews for this tv were good so I felt safe & it was a great buy. I've been a Sony guy for a long time but I'll say LG's are great too.

Reviews.Title: Best deal for the money
Reviews.Author: R. Alexander "Tech enthusiast."
Reviews.Content: I think we got this when it was on sale for $500. Couldn't be happier with the purchase. I can't believe HDTVs of this quality are this cheap nowadays.

Reviews.Title: Good Bang for the Buck
Reviews.Author: U. Nited
Reviews.Content: This TV placed tops in a recent Consumer Reports review of HDTVs in the size that I wanted (32"), so I decided to purchase it.It's a nice, no-frills TV.  Set-up was easy.  The picture offers numerous presets and lots of adjustments.The sound is the only thing I'm not content with.  The problem isn't the sound quality, it's the volume.  Between 20-80, there seems to be very little difference in volume.  Moreover, when I play Rocksmith (the guitar game which you play a real guitar with) through my XBox 360, there is a considerable delay between the time I play the guitar and the time I hear the sound of the guitar through the TV's speakers.  As a result, the game is not even playable.To counteract the sound problem, I hooked up external speakers, and there is no longer a problem.  Still, it would have been nice to not NEED to use a separate sound system.

Reviews.Title: Great price, great product, no complaints
Reviews.Author: Bayjade
Reviews.Content: Took the tv out of the box, attached stand, plugged it in to wall outlet and cable box. TV is in room with abundant sunlight in morning and we have no problem with picture quality at any time. Sound quality is good, too.  No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Quality Product
Reviews.Author: Emjaye "Emjaye"
Reviews.Content: Had a little trouble attaching the stand to this as the screws included were too short. After a trip to the hardware store and purchasing some screws I was able to attach the TV to the stand. The TV works great so far, no dead pixels, and no trouble with the actual TV itself. It works well being hooked up to a Roku device and Playstation 3. The remote is nice as well.

Reviews.Title: Got a good enough TV for a low price
Reviews.Author: Vwong
Reviews.Content: First the good part, this is probably one of the cheapest 42' LCD TV out there in the cyber world... I could not find any one in store  that comes close to this price range. So, i am happy with the purchase from a price point!I use this TV for viewing standard and cable TV programs. The image are good but not as good when compared to a prior Sharp Aquos LCD Tv i used to own. For some reason, the image does not "pop" and lacks the clarity and crisp that higher end LCD TV has to offer. That said... Again, it only cost less than half the price of those TVs. I guess something gotta give, the balance between quality and price. To reiterate, the picture quality is definitely good... Just not great.I purchase this tv set using the amazon prime membership... Hence they really did delivery within two days, amazingly.... And i am really pleased. The tv came in its original packaging... And the set up took less than 30 mins... The based board needs to be screwed to the main tv unit but it can be comfortably done by just one person and the program set up is pretty intuitive. Just press the automatic config button in the tv menu and you are all set after  5 mins of channel search.One word of warning - this tv unit has a tendency to " forget" saved channels.. This means that saved channels in prior channel search gets mysteriously deleted or omitted after about two weeks of use ( and i mean light use as i dun watch tv everyday). I had problems with Animal Planet and NatGeo... There may be other channels. At first i thought that the problem was with the cable... Then I realised that the problem is more with the TV rather than the cable network. To fix this problem i had to go through another 5 mins of channel configuration to search and save the channels. It is troublesome... But not sufficient for me to return the unit.I would definitely have rated this tv at least 4 stars ( for its value for money proposition) however, i reduced this to 3 stars because of the channel omit issue i mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: worth the wait
Reviews.Author: tanders684 "t-la"
Reviews.Content: I waited a long time to get my first HDTV.  I am so glad I picked this one.  For me, this was great value for the price.  I am so happy with this TV I am thinking about getting another.  Thanks LG.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: D03
Reviews.Content: Only bad review I read was that this TV doesn't have enough black in it's picture..just ridiculous nonsense, maybe under a microscope it is. Any who, beautiful detail and the price is very, very affordable. After searching for TVs for weeks this is the best deal for under $500

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a very good price
Reviews.Author: Karen J. Kosmoski
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up and very easy to use.  Excellent picture quality and the sound is very good.  No need for a soundbar unless you are trying to ruin your hearing.  The setup directions are not good, but I didn't need them.  I am very happy with the set and consider it a good purchase.

Reviews.Title: I love this TV
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with my LG 37" 1080p purchase.  After reading the amazon reviews I successfully adjusted the TV to my liking. It is an amazing picture!  Excellent value for the money and the 37" is the perfect size for my apartment. It doesn't overwhelm the room. I compared the LG to Samsung side by side at Best Buy. The differences were imperceptible. I purchased the LG because of better pricing on Amazon. I wouuld purchase a LG TV again.New York, NY

Reviews.Title: I like this TV.
Reviews.Author: HomieG
Reviews.Content: I bought the LK520 model (32" 1080p) from another store and thought I'd post a helpful review.Pros: Very good image quality. Good amount and variety of conections. Sturdy base with swivel. pretty lightweight and easily wallmountable. Great image tweaking feature.Cons: Contrast ratio could be a little higher but honestly I don't see much of a difference from my other tv choices. Too bad it isn't a little bit thinner but its not that thick at all. (I love those super thin LED tvs....) No actual buttons on the TV itself, you must use a remote. (Sucks if you lose the remote and have to buy another) Stay about 3-4 ft away for the best image.

Reviews.Title: Great buy, can't go wrong.
Reviews.Author: Tay
Reviews.Content: Awesome size, easy assembly, great picture quality. LG is an amazing brand when it comes to TV's and this is no exception. Picture quality looks incredible and the different color settings make for a great gaming or movie experience.

Reviews.Title: Great TV value
Reviews.Author: MIVA
Reviews.Content: Very nice TV for the price, works well, looks nice, exactly what we wanted.  Currently using it with a Sony Blu-Ray for discs and streaming, very happy with the performance.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Mark Sullivan
Reviews.Content: I've had nothing but good experiences with this TV so far. It looks good with off-air digital TV, and with a DVD player. I can't speak to how it responds to HD content. The sound is only about average, so that could be considered a weak point.

Reviews.Title: Good picture.
Reviews.Author: Jimmhotep
Reviews.Content: This TV has great options to work with an external HD, laptop, desktop, displays a clear picture, has a good array of overall features, and decent sound without having to buy an external surround sound system.

Reviews.Title: Excellent so far
Reviews.Author: Traveler
Reviews.Content: Bought this LG 42LK450 based on the recommendations (thank you, Amazon customers!) two weeks ago.  Since some very recent reviews complain about the picture, I wanted to give our experience so far.  The picture is outstanding, setup was easy -- even adding a Sony wi-fi Blu-ray for our first foray into that world -- with pre-existing DirecTV.  Sound is good to quite good.  I was apprehensive about the hookups since we are on a wireless rural tower that has its challenges.  Streaming (NetFlix, Amazon) has been good to excellent and fairly easy to set up as well.  I was reluctant to get rid of the old Toshiba CRT TV with excellent sound and picture, as it was produced back in the day when quality in TVs was reliable.  However, the captain is extremely pleased with this set and so is the admiral (60-somethings).  I was sure the 42-inch screen would be overwhelming since we only sit about 11 feet away, but it's great.  Even photos displayed from our modest point-and-shoot Canon are great. Beautiful screen with non-Blu-ray DVDs, streaming, and HD TV stations, but also very good with non-HD stations.  Excellent with Blu-ray.  Minor point, but the remote is the best ergonomic design I've seen.  We did buy locally since country living makes product returns, especially of this size, painful.  Now crossing fingers to hope the set quality is also durable.

Reviews.Title: Great Effin Deal
Reviews.Author: adolph
Reviews.Content: I was a little sceptical about buying a TV online sight unseen, but after reading the positive reviews on a few websites I took the plunge. Amazon made it easy with the price, it shipped in about two days. The picture is stunning, and the size is just right. With attenna TV it takes a while getting used to programming and re-programming channels that decide to come in that week. I like the fact you can use one remote through HDMI to control a LG dvd/blu ray. The only complaints I have are if you switch to power-save mode, the screen gets pretty dark and makes it look like the set is getting ready to die on you, not an issue if you dont go to power save mode. And the speakers are not that loud on some channels. All in all it was a great deal and plays excellent.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: K Miller
Reviews.Content: I love the LG 37" TV. It is the right size for my mobile home, the sound is terrific, and the overall look is impressive. I had previously purchased a 32" Vizion TV from Wal Mart and returned it because of the sound quality. I was relieved to find that I could find the size and brand I wanted at Amazon.com. I would highly recommend LG brand to anyone wanting a quality television.

Reviews.Title: 32 in.  LG TV
Reviews.Author: JLJ
Reviews.Content: This TV is perfect!!!  I read previous reviews about it and felt comfortable ordering it online from Amazon.  I am not disappointed.  Everything about it is exactly what I was hoping for.  I am NOT a Game Player, so I can't address that.  I am highly recommending this TV.

Reviews.Title: Really Nice TV!
Reviews.Author: Joe R
Reviews.Content: I bought the 42 inch LG tv. I had previously owned a 32 inch Samsung, but unfortunately the TV ended up being given to someone else. I figured LG is a known brand, and $500 for a 42 inch 1080p was a good deal. It came in 2 days cause of my Amazon Prime shipping, and it was pretty easy to set up. The Blu-Ray looks fantastic. I was really surprised on how clear everything was. For HD tv, I have Time Warner Cable. The HD channels don't like as good, but they still are decent. I'm assuming its the cable company and not the tv, since blu ray looks good. This tv is for my bedroom, and I do notice that you have to stand back a bit from it. Seems pretty obvious, the closer you are the more blurry it gets. When I'm sitting in my room or laying on my bed, it looks crisp and detailed. No complaints about the tv this far.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture.  Works great.
Reviews.Author: Born in '61
Reviews.Content: This tv has been a breeze from the moment it came out of the box.  The price was right, it works great.  No problems.

Reviews.Title: Love It!!!
Reviews.Author: Whatwhat
Reviews.Content: I'm not a TV aficionado or anything, but we love our TV. It's our second LG LCD television (bought a 32 inch in 2007) and both have given us no issues. This is only our 2nd LCD flat screen, so I can't compare to other brands, but when I did research (lots of research :-) LG seemed to have good value (i.e. good price and good quality).  Again, I can't compare other brands, but I feel like it has GREAT quality.  Movies, video games and HD tv shows keep us very entertained.  We haven't gone to the movies in a while as a result :-)

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: KeepingitGreen
Reviews.Content: This TV is by far the best I've ever purchased. The picture and sound are great. I strongly recommend this TV for anyone looking for quality all the way around. Easy to set up and connect all the gadgets to.

Reviews.Title: LG Television 42LK450
Reviews.Author: Dr. C. Bradenton "dr. c"
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with the LG 42LK450 television set purchased one month ago through Amazon. It has an excellent picture in every respect. It was delivered well within the estimated time and was very easy to connect and set up. However, the owner's manual and CD are terrible. They have attempted to cover too many models of sets in one instructional package. No less than 55 models are listed as being covered. Granted, there are substantial similarities in groupings of models, but there are also differences that are not obvious. We have struggled over gaining access to digital subchannels and only last night were successful. Still have not been able to set the clock to our time zone. Still the TV rates 5 stars and the instructions 1 star.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Erik Johnson
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for several months, and thus far have had absolutely no problems with it. It looks great and works well for everything, gaming, HDMI, watching movies, TV, etc.

Reviews.Title: LG 42" TV
Reviews.Author: Guzmedw
Reviews.Content: Easy to asseble. Very good basic screen images and sound of TV speakers are decent enough.  If you like cinema sound-like when seeing movies you have the option of doing your own connections.  So far, I am very satisfied with this 42" TV purchase.  I would surely recommend it without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: ReviewerGirl24
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV. Highly recommended. I love that it plays most video file types via a flash drive. Very convenient.The tv was also shipped quickly and was packaged securely.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Mo H. "Mo H."
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV as a gift for my husband for our bedroom. He watches TV before bed sometimes, so it isn't used often. The picture quality is not the best but a 32" TV for less than $300 was too good of a deal to pass up. I'm not convinced I'd buy another LG TV.

Reviews.Title: I WOULD BUY THIS TV AGAIN!!!
Reviews.Author: maria salazar
Reviews.Content: I never actually take the time to review anything... which shouldn't be the case because I read lots of reviews and research before I make any important buys. Either way... I am really impressed with this TV and the price. I purchased it on Black Friday for $300!! What a steal!!! I want to buy the same TV in other sizes for other rooms in my home. Resolution is great and I like that it has touchscreen buttons in the front to turn on and off, volume, channel and input. TOTAL RECOMMENDATION!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Ryan G. Peters
Reviews.Content: Very nice tv for the price.  Its a 300 dollar 1080p tv.  Those are hard to get, and the picture looks fantastic.  They could use some bass. I'll definitely invest in surround sound. I haven't had a single problem with it so far and hope it will last quite a while.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!
Reviews.Author: C~A~T
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived in perfect condition and it works great! I love it. Also it mounted to the wall with no trouble, all the parts were included and everything was great! Buy this TV if you are looking for a great deal on a large TV!

Reviews.Title: tv quality
Reviews.Author: tweetiebabe
Reviews.Content: Tv picture quality is astounding, 42 inch is enough to appear like you're in the theater & occasionally,in the picture itself. Easy set-up, though it does take a few hrs, so allow time, and delivery is so much better than trying to chug it home yourself & bouncing it up the stairs (or in the elevator.)I luv it, literally, wonderful for anything u want to see & super for movies. Was fun for the super bowl, but even better for seeing a movie. I had a 37" before, but this is so much better!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Kara Poulios
Reviews.Content: I deliberated over which TV to buy for weeks, trying to find the best deal when I stumbled upon this one. The size is good for the price and I have no complaints. There was some adjusting of the settings when I first received it but the picture is beautiful and the sound quality is great. It's a perfect TV for a bedroom.

Reviews.Title: LG LK 450
Reviews.Author: Karen Klein
Reviews.Content: I like the TV the sound and picture are OK for the price but be prepared to do some adjusting of the color and backlighting on the TV from its standard settings.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: LG
Reviews.Content: Good TV over all, the only complaint would be that the Intellisensor was very noticeable, it would have better to dim slowly to allow your eyes to adjust. The quick change makes it feel too dark when you cut out the lights.

Reviews.Title: Good product and good price
Reviews.Author: lv0046
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the pruchase. The only issue I have is that it appears to take longer for the tv to switch cahnnels versus my previous sets.

Reviews.Title: I Love a Great Bargain!
Reviews.Author: BZB
Reviews.Content: This TV was a Christmas gift for my out-of-state brother.  I chose this LG after going to my local stores to physically compare the pic & performance of various brands of TV's.  Reading many reviews online for this TV convinced me that I had made the right choice.  Amazon purchase was smooth and easy.  I tracked delivery on line and made the trip to my brother's on the day the LG arrived.  This product is everything that I anticipated when I read the reviews on it.  We are extremely pleased with the quality, clarity, color and performance.  We feel that we got a lot of TV for the price -- this was a great bargain!

Reviews.Title: Like it Better Then Samsung
Reviews.Author: Frank "Squidder"
Reviews.Content: Our last two TV purchases were Samsung which we are also very happy with. After comparing prices found the LG to be less expensive with equally high rating (thank you Amazon raters)and made the purchase. Out of the box it was a hit I found the picture to be sharper with richer color, my wife found them pretty much equal. Very happy and would recommend. Four stars just because of not knowing the long term reliability.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant picture
Reviews.Author: MamaJo
Reviews.Content: We bought this tv for the toy room.  Our cable company did away with the analog signal so we upgraded so we could receive the DTV signals without connecting to a box.  I paid the extra $4 for next day delivery and it arrived in less than 24 hours after I ordered it.  Super easy to set up and the picture is fantastic - especially for not being hooked up to a cable box!  I didn't know regular tv could look this good!  And it's straight out of the box, I didn't even mess with the setting yet.  We also played Wii and hooked up Netflix and no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: coolest TV I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: William Raggio
Reviews.Content: It was a breeze to set up and the feature that adjusts screen brightness according to room lighting is incredible

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Marie E. Macri "creation gal"
Reviews.Content: The TV is great -- Verizon FIOS is the problem.  When I first hooked it up I was terribly disappointed in the color and the clarity since I still didn't have the high definition setbox from Verizon.  Once I got that -- what a difference.  The only problem still not resolved is getting the Verizon remote to control the TV no matter what I try - it doesn't seem to recognize LG product code.  But that is not the LG problem -- that is Verizon support (which is at best minimal).  I would recommend that you pay the extra and get the LED version -- if you are not looking straight at the TV the picture is fuzzy.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: spatt
Reviews.Content: This is our second LG television. The first one - a plasma - has been a terrific television. It works great and has a beautiful picture. When we needed to replace an older heavy traditional type television, we definitely wanted another LG. We were limited to a smaller size and LG offered exactly what we needed. We had some concerns since this one is an LCD and not a plasma, but we didn't need to worry.This new LG also has a beautiful picture. We are very happy with it. I highly recommend LG. Delivery from Amazon was very fast and free! It arrived in great shape.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be more pleased
Reviews.Author: PatK
Reviews.Content: First, I have never ordered a TV on-line.  Always been hesitant to do so.  But my experience with this TV and Amazon has definitely changed my mind.  The set arrived about three days earlier than the soonest-anticipated date and in excellent shape.  Thanks, Amazon.  I will do this again.Second, this TV replaced an 11-year-old Panasonic Quasar which was still going strong in my family room/office.  However, it was time for a change and I'm extremely happy that I did.  This TV is excellent for what it is - a 37" lower-end set.  Color is great and currently is just hooked up to my cable line without a box and therefore without an HDMI cable.  I was going to get both but with what I'm seeing at this point, may decide not to do that.  Sound is good although I may add a sound system, but again, really not necessary for where the TV is.This set makes my third LG TV and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this brand. The price was right, the service by Amazon exceptional, and the TV itself is great.  What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: hannyc
Reviews.Content: I love this TV.  The picture quality is great and the controls are easy.  The hardest thing was to attach the screen to the base because the instructions were not as clear as I would have liked.

Reviews.Title: Great tv great sound and picture
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: This tv is awesome, apparently every tv in this price range has a problem with poor sound but not this one.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: CrimsonNinja
Reviews.Content: I mainly use this TV for gaming. After switching the power saving mode off (it get's annoying when it auto dims the screen)it was practically perfect for the price. I just wish I could have a little more control in the settings menus.Pros:-Great Price-Great display-Good amount of input connections-Has VGA input-Swivel standCons:-Power-saving mode auto dims the display (can be switched off)-Settings menu gives little control

Reviews.Title: Great deal, awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Happy
Reviews.Content: This is the first LCD tv that I bought and I couldn't be happier, the seller is very responsive and the tv is awesome. The deal I got on this TV is unbelievable and it came within 4 days. Thank you and keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for entry level
Reviews.Author: Robert Stevens
Reviews.Content: Not bad for a secondary TV.  Definitely better than I expected from an entry level priced TV.  Would recommend to others.Pros:-Decent color reproduction-Bright back light (cold cathode)-decent sound, not special but not bad either.-reasonable thickness (~3-4 inches)-Auto energy setting: this automatically adjusts the backlight based upon the ambient light in the room.  I love this feature.  We watch TV in bed with no lights on and the TV does not blind you.  In daylight it automatically ramps the backlight back up.Cons:-NOT LED backlit.  The tech specs on the amazon listing say its LED backlit... its not.  Its a standard cold cathode light.-Poor black levels and contrast (but about like pretty much every other LCD set I have seen).  The dynamic contrast settings seem to do a decent job at compensating for the LCD technology though.  Still pretty watchable.-Color reproduction on auto energy mode: One of the big reasons I bought this unit is the auto backlight sensor.  However, when you have it turned on, it auto changes the color, contrast, sharpness and other settings as well.  This negates any corrections you might have made using the color wizard.  If you choose the "corrected" color profile, it no longer uses the automatic lighting sensor.

Reviews.Title: NICE!
Reviews.Author: Renee
Reviews.Content: Purchased this to replace my son's bedroom standard definition tv. Product was shipped promptly and arrived in excellent condition. The picture is awesome, the sound is great. It's easy to operate. It has plenty of connections for his gaming. Very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: LG TV Excellent
Reviews.Author: DixieGirl
Reviews.Content: Excellent buying experience from start to finish.  Price very competitive.  Love the new TV.  Very easy setup and use.  Great picture!

Reviews.Title: lg42lk450
Reviews.Author: J. A. Rutkowski
Reviews.Content: delivered in two days. set up went well. Picture is excellent. No problems in first month. I believe LG hd tv is about as good as Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Great new tv
Reviews.Author: S. Audish
Reviews.Content: Just got this TV on New Year's Eve. Took longer to purchase it than it did to set up. Four screws in the base and four screws into the TV and a power cord completed the set up. Afterwards I plugged up the cable and the TV was off and running. Picked this one up at Best Buy for 189 + tax so it was a steal. I've been playing PS3 games on it constantly and I cannot see where 120hz could improve the picture. TV's auto color function is a little strange to get used to if you are used to bright plasma's in dark rooms. The tv will not choose to be bright if the room is dark and for some people manual settings will be preferred.

Reviews.Title: LOTS of inputs, nice picture (after calibration)
Reviews.Author: J. HOGG
Reviews.Content: I picked this up back in June (or July?) from a local not-so-big-box electronics-and-appliances store (they've only got 2 locations) for $469.99 (they price matched HH Gregg without any hassle) + tax - 5% cash back on my Citibank Mastercard... $481.09 total.  Really nice picture quality after spending quite a bit of time tweaking/calibrating the picture (there are tons of picture settings, some meant for a professional calibration).  Very nice picture as long as I'm looking at it straight on (I lost the panel lottery and got a VA panel :( ).PROS:* Lots of inputs!  TWO composite, TWO component (none of that combined component/composite input crap), an RF (wouldn't really be a TV without one :-D ), three HDMI, a VGA (some TV's don't have this), a USB (to view pictures and videos and listen to music from a thumb drive), and a headphone jack (quite a few TV's nowadays don't even have an analog stereo out!)* Nice HD and decent SD picture with natural colors... worlds better than the picture of the 13 year old Sanyo 32" CRT TV it replaced.  I did have to do quite a bit of messing with settings though and I have the backlight cranked out to nearly the max values.  I'm worried that the backlight will crap out in 5 years or less since this TV runs about 14-16 hours a day at my house.CONS:* The viewing angle of the VA panel!  It's terrible!  The picture looks washed out unless I look at the TV straight on.  At least the stand swivels and I can swivel the TV so I can look at it straight on, but some of the picture is cut off when I swivel it in the entertainment center it sits in.* The sound.  It's not horrible, but the 32" Sanyo it replaced had MUCH better sound.  Being in an entertainment center cabinet helps the sound somewhat.Overall:  Nice TV and so far so good, but I'm wondering if I would have been better off to pony up the extra $100-$200 for an LED-backlit model since this TV runs 14+ hours a day?  The Sanyo CRT TV is still OK, aside from the cruddy picture quality, after being run 14+ hours daily for 7 1/2 years.UPDATE (1/6/14):  Still fabulous two and half years after purchase.  Awesome picture.  The only reason I'm leaving my review at 4 stars is because of the poor sound quality from the built-in speakers, but most HDTV's have crummy built-in speakers, and this LG set is no exception.

Reviews.Title: Good product!!
Reviews.Author: Satya
Reviews.Content: Everything about this TV is very is good. The only trouble I have with this TV is that it can't recognize an external Hard drive larger than 1 TB. (Infact this is the case with many other TVs and also with my Roku 2 XS player as well, So I wouldn't crib about this much).Through the HDMI cable you can connect to your Computer, Roku player etc., and the USB port will let you play the content from an external Hard drive or a Pen drive. The built in media player is very good and has all the controls required.The picture quality is very good too.For $500 this is a very good TV..

Reviews.Title: Nice for the price!
Reviews.Author: JohnJohn
Reviews.Content: I wanted a television to replace my old (HEAVY!) 31" tube type.  I ordered this 32" LG from Amazon at a very good price.  On arrival, it was a snap to hook up.  Great picture! AND light enough to pick up with one hand!

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: The Captain
Reviews.Content: First, the price was right. Second,the service was tops.THird,the LG/LCD TV is better than I thought it would be. Picture and sound are 5 stars.I hope I can say this a year from now.

Reviews.Title: I love it.
Reviews.Author: Dolores Braswell
Reviews.Content: I have had my LG 42LK450 42-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LCD HDTVfor almost a year and could not be happier with it.  It's everything I wanted in a TV and more. The picture clarity is wonderful and the size is just right for my living room.  There are so many settings for your personal preferences that I can't imagine anyone not being thrilled with this product.

Reviews.Title: Mom/Grandma's Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: Anthony D. Colardo
Reviews.Content: We wanted to purchase a new television for my mother with a large screen as she is 82 and finds it sometimes difficult to see everything on her old television.  We did have concerns that the images would appear "stretched" as she did not purchase the high definition option from her dish company. We were very pleased with picture and the ease of setting up everything.  Mom said it is the best gift that she has every received.

Reviews.Author: Gem2012
Reviews.Content: I just bought this product during the time of thanksgiving. It was a steal at this offer. I was not sure about the performance, but just took a risk as it wasn't a big investment. But this product has exceeded my expectations. I write this review after using this product for about a month. Too good to invest in such product. This model received the top rating from Consumer Reports and I avoided Black Friday mayhem by getting it from Amazon with free shipping.  The set was easy to set up with our cable box and has performed well for a month now.  I kind of wish I'd gone slightly bigger (37"?) but the price difference between $299 and the larger screens was too much to justify (to me).  This LG model is a huge step up from the old CRT TV we had previously.  I'm a happy camper.  The four stars is a reflection on my general belief that hardly anything is perfect.

Reviews.Title: A good desk top TV for the office or bedroom

Reviews.Content: We needed a 2nd TV, our tastes differ and our other TV is in the living room and mainly watched by my wife watching dramas, news and QVC.  The primary TV is an LG 37" in an armorer, this 32" LG is on a desktop wing and has the same quality, good picture, decent sound.  I use it to watch football, road racing and financial news. Reviews.Content: We had this TV hooked up and running in no time. Reviews.Title: great tv

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Size and Price
Reviews.Author: Dom B
Reviews.Content: This TV was highly rated by Consumer's Report, and they were correct-- great picture and for the price, incredible. we fully recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Good.
Reviews.Author: KAC
Reviews.Content: The TV was delivered promptly.  Easy and quick to set up.  Volume can seem a little low for a TV of good quality, but I think its because many might expect to only having to go to 20 or 30 to reach a necessary volume level.  However I've experienced the necessity to turn it up to the 50-70 range to get the volume level you really want (I was surprised it even went this high!).But overall, for $299, there really wasn't much to complain about.  Good picture, decent sound, easy to use.  What more could you ask for!

Reviews.Title: STUNNING
Reviews.Author: bones "bones"
Reviews.Content: My short recommendation:If you are planning to go for eitherLG 42LK450 42-Inch 1080p 60Hz LCD HDTV [..]orLG 42LV3500 42-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LED-LCD HDTV [..]and BlueRigger High Speed HDMI Cable with Ethernet 6.6 Feet (2m) - Supports 3D and Audio Return [Latest Version] [..]Just go for these provided you are willing to go through some POSSIBLE TV return/exchange hassle (I could have just been the unforunate one but Amazon has ensured SO FAR I never felt that way - but I plan to update this review if they don't continue giving me the same comfort feeling with this TV buying experience episode)Details:LED LCD [LG 42LV3500] vs regular LCD [LG 42LK450]I had an opportunity to look at both these TVs and I should say, the picture quality is nothing less than STUNNING for both of them.There is a reason for the high number of positive reviews and I think it is the stunning picture quality that doesn't stop WOW-ing. While I like the natural color quality in the regular LCD, my wife liked the crispness of LED-LCD picture and also the thickness of the LED LCD TV was way smaller than the regular LCD TV. While personally I liked the regular LCD better (you get a more natural TV like color feel), my wife liked the LED-LCD (you get a more Computer Monitor like feel). Another thing to note, LG 42LV3500 I received has a matte finish (but don't expect the matte level of computer monitors, there is still some glossiness on LG 42LV3500, but it sure seems like a Matte finish screen. It could even be an IPS panel but I don't know that for sure). LG 42LK450 I received has a glossy finish. Some people might like glossy monitors as opposed to matte and possibly because of the same reason I felt the regular LCD had more natural looking colors.I used the following 1080p video on Youtube to test the TV picture quality and sound quality as well. I got this link when I googled for 1080p songs. This is a song apparently from Indian cinema with A.R. Rehman's music with bright colors in the song. Make sure you change the 360p on the right bottom of the video to 1080p HD before playing the video. Just search for "ROBO HD VIDEO SONG Endhiran Bluray 1080p x264 DTS 5 1 Raj1402" in youtube and click on the first link.[..]I used the bluerigger HDMI cable running from my computer to the TV. You can see how this song and it's bright colors fill the screen, it is simply stunning on the TV.Sound qualityIf you want to avoid going through manual audio quality set up, just choose Cinema sound mode (You don't need need to necessarily choose Cinema picture along with Cinema sound, you can choose Cinema sound quality and leave the default/off picture mode) and the cinema mode sound is pretty loud enough for me.Refresh quality [60hz]:Honestly I am yet to notice what people seemed to talk about a lot. I think choosing a HDTV can be a hit or miss depending on the model. So just because a model has 120hz doesn't mean you are gaining something. You might end up losing on the picture quality if that model turns out bad. Same with looking for a SMART wifi TV and taking a gamble on possibly losing out picture quality. I can tell you from my own experience, both LG 42LV3500 and LG 42LK450 have stunning picture quality.If you are going to be watching sports all the time, this may or may not be the right model for you, but I can't really speak for it because i don't watch much sports and i haven't notice any difference on fast moving movie scenes. If you keep looking for a difference, you may notice something that might not even be closely related to the 60hz refresh rate but you might think, "oh, this might not happen if it was 120hz". Bottom line, if you are very particular about it, go to Best buy or your friend's place with some fast moving sports video and request them to check your video out on both 60 & 120hz TVs and see if you notice any difference and whether that difference makes any difference to you.Now coming to the POSSIBLE TV return/exchange hassle (I could have just been the unforunate one but Amazon has ensured SO FAR I never felt that way - but I plan to update this review if they don't continue giving me the same comfort feeling with this TV buying experience episode)My first LG 42LK450 arrived with a gaping hole on the center of the box [I guess it happened during shipping]. I REFUSED the delivery. So no real hassle there for me. Courier person offered that I open and find out if there any damage. If I had done that I suppose it would equal to accepting the shipment and then I would have gone through the return process. Anyways, I simply refused the courier person's offer and delivery. Amazon sent me a replacement immediately. The replacement arrived in good shape but when I kept using it, it was emitting a strong plastic smell from behind the TV whenever the TV was on. Amazon was very sorry, created an RMA and it went back to Amazon as well.My first LG 42LV3500 arrived in good shape [i mean the outside box] but had a dent behind the TV that was causing light bleed right at the place of the dent. Amazon once again was very sorry and this was replaced immediately.

Reviews.Title: Solid value from a reputable manufacturer.
Reviews.Author: Kurt from Iowa
Reviews.Content: I'll preface this review by stating that it pertains to the 42" model.I ordered this TV just over a week ago, and got 1 day shipping for crazy cheap with Amazon Prime.  There are some reviews out there which are skeptical of the blackness of the picture and quality of moving pictures with the 60hz refresh rate - but I couldn't be happier.  This is my 4th HDTV, 2 crts, 1 lower-end 42" lcd Black Friday deal from a few years ago and now this 42" LG LCD.  This is by far the class of the lot, and a real value at under $500.I've got it running 1080p with my Xbox 360, and 480i through my ancient DirecTV box.  Video games and dvds are excellent, the picture is smooth and the colors are quite rich and bold.  Even TV shows look solid with the crappy input quality, which is a pleasant surprise.The sound from the set leaves a little to be desired, but most manufacturers bank on the consumer using an alternative audio system anyways.  I used the TVs built-in speakers for about a day before robbing the 2.1 Altec Lansing system from my desktop.  One nice thing about the TV is that it features a headphone jack as one of the audio output options, so you can hook up darn near any speaker set to it.  I've actually already ordered a higher end 2.1 system with an Optical Input to step-up the quality and return sound to my desktop.Overall, I really couldn't be happier with my purchase.  $500 to spend on a luxury item doesn't fall from the sky often around here, so I like to research my purchases pretty hard before buying.  LG is one of the few manufacturer who produce their own screens, so that's a bit of a perk, and the 1 year warranty through LG is always a plus.  Don't be fooled by critical reviews who expected a $1000 tv set for ~$500. The tv is very aesthetically pleasing, and it's performance will make you smile.Buy without worry.  I would again, that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: J. Hopkins
Reviews.Content: None of the preset picture adjustments suited me but after fiddling with the custom settings awhile, I got a very nice picture overall. One thing I noticed, not unique to this TV I'm sure, is that if the received picture is not good quality, it can be worse than on a CRT set. However, when receiving an HD picture on this TV it is impressive -- at times almost 3-D. I like the remote control -- good ergonomic design.This is my first widescreen TV and I don't like the "stretch" factor which makes everyone appear very wide! This is not always the case and seems dependent upon the program being broadcast. Fortunately, the remote has a ratio button that allows changing the ratio to be done relatively easily to suit the various broadcast formats being received. But then you sometimes end up with a picture that doesn't fill the whole screen horizontally. Life gets more complicated every day!If I had it to do over, this is the TV I would buy. I considered a "smart" TV but decided not to go that route. Their main advantage appears to be the ability to download/stream movies, which I am not into. I understand they give a lot of trouble and many get returned. There's just too much stuff in them to go wrong. Besides, if it's like my recently purchased "smart phone" it would be pathetic. The phone does a lot of stuff when it's working but occasionally it decides not to send or receive PHONE CALLS and requires rebooting. Sometimes it reboots itself. Oh well, that's another subject so I won't belabor the point.

Reviews.Title: LG: Big (Screen) DIsappointment
Reviews.Author: The Amazon Reviewer
Reviews.Content: I had purchased a samsung 40" LCD recently and I was (and still am) VERY pleased with it's picture quality.I was frustrated however with it's limited inputs and connectivity. I came across reviews for this LG set, which is slightly bigger, cost about the same, yet has more hdmi inputs as well as headphone jack, among other connection options.I had this item shipped via overnight shipping.SHIPPING:-The tv arrived the next day, but in less than pristine condition. A plastic part from the frame had broken off during transit.Things got worse as I actually hooked up the tv. There were dark vertical lines down the screen, apparent only against a light background, but still quite obvious. What most likely occurred is that the tv was shipped FACE DOWN on the screen. I looked at the box again and noticed that the cardboard grain is vertical and the spacing matched the lines on the tv.This is enough to convince me that shipping a large item in a hurry by harried, hurried, rushed delivery companies during one of the most hectic shopping and shipping periods is not necessarily a good idea.THE TV:PROS:1. lots of connection options: 3 hdmi, speakerphone jack, side hdmi with component in, digital audio out.2. big screen for the price.3. the menu system is intuitive (for the most part) and offers lots of options.4. excellent menu system for calibrating and adjusting the picture.5. sound quality is not bad at all.6. documentation is very good, albeit on a cd.7. LG is thoughtful enough to include a microfiber cleaning clothCONS:1. the tuner is not very good. It doesn't pick up as many stations as the samsung, and is VERY slow to run through all channels in auto tuning.2. picture quality is not very impressive, at least not compared to the samsung.3. customer service is a joke. I called several times and none of the speakers could speak english fluently. They were very confused by some basic questions about inputs and connections.PICTURE QUALITY:The LG was a big disappointment, no pun intended.First, the good news. In ideal circumstances, the LG can give you a very good picture, even an excellent one. For instance, if there is no natural light, and you are watching a perfect high def digital source (a recent film release on blu ray), the LG does in fact look very good.HOWEVER, picture quality with broadcast sources is really bad. It's not clear why, but satellite and over the air digital tv sources look horrible. There is a horrible amount of noise for instance on the local network station, which is less than ten miles away, and broadcasts in 1080i.With satellite tv, pixelation, artifacts and noise are very apparent. The samsung handles both broadcast and satellite sources with ease, however.Also, the LG's picture is much darker, the colors less saturated and they are not as accurate as on the samsung. Samsung color accuracy is excellent: the blues on avatar are beautiful for instance.By comparison, it seems almost impossible to get a nice looking picture color wise, with the LG. I spent many hours using the picture wizard as well as manually adjusting the multiple picture settings on my own. Regardless, the picture seems too dark even with contrast settings set to near max, and everything seemed to have a gold/brown/green cast. It almost seemed as if outdoor scenes were always filmed at dusk, or indoor scenes in poor lighting.Given these serious problems with picture quality, I am puzzled by this tv's stellar reviews. It's likely that the majority of buyers are stepping up from old CRT's or older generation lcd's and find this unit a big step up.However, I am comparing this set to a new samsung, and the differences in quality are very noticeable. The bottom line is that it's not fun watching broadcast tv on this LG. The picture is always noisy, even with very strong signals broadcast in 1080i.Do yourself a favor and take a look at a samsung.

It is what you get for the price, a lower end HDTV.I had previously owned a Samsung, and its picture quality was superior to this TV.The HD picture quality is reasonably good, though not as good as my previous TV. The picture quality for the SD channels is not at all up to the mark.Also, the TV does not have an inbuilt antenna to catch over the air channels (or has one that did not catch any channels for me).I got one for ten bucks at RadioShack. Some of the OTA channels show disturbance when I press "Info" on the remote.I don't know if this will be true for cable also. I have no intention of having cable, and I plan to integrate this with my Logitech revue, which I ordered this week from Amazon. We will see how that works out.The sound is not terribly good, but I always have my TV sound hooked up to the speaker, so I don't care. I am not too picky about sound too. Also, the TV software does not show information about program schedules of a particular channel. It only shows the current program, and the next one, and thats it.So, all in all, a no frills TV. Don't expect too much out of it. The price point is what won me over. I plan to combine it with a smart box, and make it as smart as I want. The price on the TV leaves enough on my wallet to go for a top notch smart box. I am not much of a cable watcher. I watch most of my stuff over the net. So, for me it was a good TV to watch netflix and stuff. I am not too happy with it, but would not go the trouble of returning it too. I can live with it.

Reviews.Title: LG 42LK450-UB TV - matte screen TV with no frame reflection problem
Reviews.Author: Cyborg "RoadRunner"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for LED LCD TV for about 3 weeks now, I had to upgrade my old and trusted for many years 36 inch CRT "Godzilla" (170 lbs LOL) and I gave up few times because of futures, pricing point, durability or manufacturer reputation. The biggest problem was that all so fashionable black piano gloss bezel. I am so not-into that annoying shine some think looks awesome that I already purchased big value pack of 1200 grid sanding paper to deal with the problem. I looked at ViewSonic 42 inch ( have 2 wide screen computer monitors from them) but it was not in stock and price was 150 bucks more for no reason. About shiny frame - you watch TV and on top of frame light reflection from behind you see also picture reflection of the TV in the frame as well. Therefore, my choice was this LG model 42LK450 after checking, looking, testing, reading reviews and deciding what I want - cool TV, not a headache. IT DOES HAVE SHINY FRAME - BUT IT DOES NOT GIVE REFLEXION PROBLEM DUES TO THE WAY IT IS POSITIONED. Some complain about sound - well, takes 5 seconds with remote to turn sound setting to Music or Cinema and you are fine - it is changing sound EQ settings and dynamic response. Better yet - get sound system with the sub if you like house shaking and do not expect 500 Watts hyper bass and heavenly treble from unit that measures couple of inches in thickness. One mention here - the audio out is fiber optic which is excellent because no magnetic distortions and hum noise, but your sound system will need to have that and many do (good fiber audio 6ft long can be purchased on Amazon for something like 6 bucks). Bottom line why this TV:1. LED LCD with very good picture at about half k price delivered2. fully and in detail adjustable picture3. few sound modes4. solid construction (I stay away from cheap because they cost too much eventually)5. watching picture one can tell if it is SD or HD - this TV is not faking output6. many different inputs including regular VGA and flat mount HDMI for wall hanging7. component and composite input for any new or old DVD player you may have8. USB for firmware update and whatever you fancy and9. NO REFLEXION FROM THE FRAME without having to sand it down (it is 90 degrees flat and resonably thin yet strong)10. NO REFLEXION FROM THE SCREEN - it is made OEM semi- matte like good quality computer monitors11. nice digital TV tuner antenna input - you can retire your PITA analog converter boxand use LG TV remote to control off the air channelsYou could spent 2k on same size TV that will have some more goodies, like Netflix net connect, very high refresh, or be programmed to make coffee and walk your dog (just kidding), but considering technology fast pace, I am happy to have 42 inch Hi-Res screen from no-nonsense TV made by reputable manufacturer that works so well. I will buy OLED as my next TV, I am certain, but for today, winter 2011, I am very happy with my decision on this LG model. I wish you could see and hear the latest Celtic Woman concert on this television running on PBS off the air now when I type this review - it feels absolutely and positively divine.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV for a Fabulous Price
Reviews.Author: tech*geek
Reviews.Content: I'm currently using this in my college dorm room and plan on using it for as long as it lasts.  The tv has a glossy black  black finish on the base and edge of the tv which looks nice.  Whats not as nice is the fact that there can be some bad glare off the screen due to this glossy like finish on the screen.  The function buttons on the television are all touch sensitive but I do NOT think they are very responsive, there are times where i try touching them like an ipod screen and times when i feel like I have to mash down in order to get a response. Moral of that story, don't lose your remote!!!!The remote itself has a matte black finish and is ergonomic in the fact that when you pick it up your thumb will hover right over the volume, channel, mute, and home buttons and using those all feel very comfortable.  If you want to access the number buttons or setting sbuttons you'll have to shift your hand up or down, the remote feels very long, but the buttons here are really responsive :)The inputs on this tv are what you will expect on this class, a composite, hdmi, headphones output, and usb input on the left side of the tv *** whats nice is that none of these are visible when viewing the tv, they're tucked away slightly behind the tv.  As a result of this, there is not a real accessibility difference between these side and back inputs.  My favorite inpt on this tv is the RGB PC input.  using this with my lenovo thinkpad there are times when the tv doesn't recognize the pc, but after unplugging and replugging the RGB cable back in the resolution and color is incredible.  This means watching videos and movies from your laptop is made easy, and using it as a dual monitor is EASY!!!Then the major use I get out of the TV comes from the Xbox 360.  There is no motion lag from playing games like Halo, or Madden and split screen gaming has never looked better.There are extensive options for adjusting color and picture settings, as well as a consumer friendly color calibrating option.  If you have any questions about specifics here feel free to ask, but you most likely wont have to adjust these setings too much.  the color was calibrated just fine when used as a photoshop monitor for my laptop.The price was perfect, amazon shipped it for 4 dollars overnight with amazon prime, that's flat out amazing.  I would highly recommend this tv to anyone, i absolutely love it.  Only downfall would be sound quality, but thats expected for a tv this small,  I would recommend using the "music" setting for best quality.

Reviews.Content: This 32" TV is good and close to being pretty good. I thought that the TV was not able to get bright enough for that pop in contrast that I like to see. I calibrate all my TVs based on using various calibration Blu-Rays as well as utilizing AVS forum user suggestions. While this may not be as good as a professional calibration, it usually works out well. I had this TV stacked up against the TCL 32", Sony 32EX310 and Samsung 32" 360 series. In the end, the TCL 32" seemed to provide an acceptable picture just not as detailed as the others, but it was able to provide better contrast than the LG & Sony (I was surprised as well). The LG when dialed in had the edge in PQ but I felt that it was still too soft. In the end, I stuck with my Samsung as I felt the picture was not as soft as the Sony and LG and provided enough contrast and sharpness to edge the others out. If you can get this TV for under $300, then it may be worth it, but with several other 720p's for $250 and under available, you may want to look at those first.
